"This place is honestly a solid 4 stars in my opinion. Saw the glowing reviews on yelp and decided to check it out. My boyfriend was a bit hesitant when I warned him of the hour + wait. Parking is a bit compacted and was full when we first arrived around 1130, but eventually we could park. The wait didn't seem that bad (but I don't mind waiting if it is worthwhile). We talked to other BBQ goers about what they wanted to order, etc to pass the time. They do provide complimentary water and when you get close to the front if you can stack 10 stones and snap a picture they will give you a free smoke pecan pie. Speaking of the pie... it's great! I do not even like pecan pie normally and I ate one by myself. Now to main feature... THE MEAT. I thought the fatty brisket was worth it. So good. Never had anything comparable... everything else was good but not note worthy. They had almost ran out of pulled pork by the time we were helped (~1245) but my boyfriend didn't even finish the sandwich. The flavor was just ok. I also had the smoked turkey. Overall good experience, good service and good food, but just good not great."

"First, I will say we all LOVE this place. Hands down the BEST BBQ in town. The meats are amazing, love the grits and really it's all great food. That said I took two stars away because of the line. "When I think of the best BBQ I've ever had in my life, Little Miss BBQ comes to mind.  Not only is this the one of the best BBQ joints in AZ, it's one of the best restaurants in AZ, period.

Even though I've only tried the brisket, I can tell whatever you order from this joint is going to be amazing!  No shortcuts, no substitutes, this is the real deal Holyfield!!

"Life-changing Beef Rib....stupid fucking good lol. So good, you have to swear to show emphasis! XD

Beautiful smoke ring, thick, flavorful bark and incredibly tender. The meat was so fatty and oily that you could see the wetness/moisture when pulling apart the meat. Incredible!

We arrived about an hour and fifteen minutes prior to open, and were STILL number 76 in line. About another 2 HOURS of wait after doors opened...but we were able to try everything!

Don't forget the Smoked Pecan Pie! I was in such a food coma that I told myself I would only have one bite of the pie....and then we ate it all after realizing how awesome that was too lol.

They take limited numbers of to-go orders if you plan out a week or two in advance.

I will probably eat here EVERY Phoenix visit! But I will not wait in the line again. Would be hard to justify the wait without these insane beef ribs and pecan pie :P

Enjoy!"
"Very well smoked and seasoned meats. Best BBQ outside Georgia or Kansas City I've had! Don't skip the Pecan Pie.  Go early, at 130pm they were running low on some meats already.
It's a classic meat counter style place with a small seating area and a line outside. 
Very clean counter, kitchen area and dining area. The guys here care very much about what they do and it shows in every way. 
Definitely a solid place and we will eat here every time we come to Phoenix."
"Been wanting to come here for quite sometimes now and finally made it. The food itself was delicious but not out of this world. After one hour and 39 minutes standing in line, outside in the heat, and hungry, I thought nothing will taste better but I have had better bbq. Parking lot was small so we had to park across the street and J-walked over. Between the three of us, we ordered almost everything on the menu exception the pie (very simple menu), and some Togo. We would come back but only if we're close by and the line is much more ch shorter."
"Eat your heart out Texas.  This is as good as barbecue gets. Others I have dined with rave about the pulled pork, and the pieces of sausage that I've sampled while waiting in line are in their own league.

Speaking of waiting on line, expect to do it unless you get there well before they open.  Everyone takes it in stride and the food makes the wait worthwhile.  This place blows away any other BBQ place in the Phoenix area."

"950th REVIEW!!!!!!

Believe the hype!! Believe it!

The day finally came were I had nothing but time to stand in a line for what's been said to be the best bbq in the valley!

I thought I arrived at a pretty good time for line standing since it was still well over an hour before it opened, but from my spot in the line I could see I was around the 1 hour and 20-minute mark!! 

Little Miss BBQ is every engaging with us in the line, handing out samples of the sausages, and keeping us entertained and even apologetic for having to stand in the line.  I think this personal touch with their customers help with the repeat/new customers, it's nice to know they like us coming too!

I finally made it up to the counter and knew what I had to have!! I went with a plate with 2 sides, ordered the beef brisket with coleslaw and jalapeno cheddar grits.

I was actually pretty lucky to find a table inside to eat my meal too, but on all tables is 3 bottle of sauces, sweet and tangy mustard, spicy and house.  I tried them all and all area great tasting, the one that surprised me the most was the sweet and tangy mustard, damn that is some good stuff! You start thinking off all kinds of things you can sauce of up with that! 

The beef brisket was the star of the plate! Juicy, tender, smoked to perfection, melt in your mouth good! HOT DAMN THIS IS SOME GREAT BBQ! Oh and boy did I love the jalapeno grits too!! 

Like I said believe the hype! Its real, Little Miss BBQ is legit! Already planning my next trip back!"

"Some of the best bbq in the valley. This comes with a huge drawback, however. People are here in a lunch break you are not only losing potentially thousands per week by not getting through the line fast enough, but also the amount of people who leave because they either don't have time to wait in a ridiculous line or flat out don't want to. "Best BBQ ever, or at least in AZ. Got here at 10:35, waited in line almost 2 hours, got our food around 12:15 but worth it. They passed out a few samples while we were in line & passed out free water bottles. What makes the line so slow is when they open at 11AM people order large amounts for people not there or big group orders. So you may only see a few people in front of you but chances are some of them are ordering a lotttttt of food.

Anyways, on to the food. I got the 2 meat plate with lean brisket & pulled pork. They come with 2 sides so I got the jalapeno cheddar grits and the baked beans. All of it was AMAZING. We actually took half of ours home for leftovers. The BBQ sauces on the table are great too, make sure you grab some to go. Two 2-meat plates & 1 soda = $39 ; I think the meals are $16ish each

Would definitely come back when I'm in the mood to wait in 2 hour long line. My advice would be to get there early like 9:30-10AM so at least you're one of the first people when they open at 11 AM and don't have to wait for all of the people with large orders."

"I hope people love my reviews as much as I love giving them. This one ought to be useful. Be PREPARED TO WAIT. I mean it's a good 1-2hour wait regardless of when you get there. The first person I actually saw get food told me he got there at about 1030 (it opens at 11) and there were people ahead of him. They provide chairs and they mark the wait time along the line similar to Disneyland if you can believe it. And...they bring out samples to entice you in to staying. I saw on their Instagram people wait in the rain and the heat which says a lot to me; I personally was quite thankful for the lovely weather. Also, when they run out...that's it. They ran out of Turkey in the first hour and ran out of brisket (which was in my opinion the BEST meat I tried) in the first 2 and half hours. They offer brisket, pulled pork, sausage, and turkey. The sides are nothing to write home about but in truth you don't need them, the meat is that good. For a side I'd pick the beans above all else. Both sauces are good but the little miss bbq sauce is best, so yummy. The pecan pie is delicious despite the fact that it's not my drug of choice. Skip the pumpkin Nutella, it sounds better than it is. Lastly, the gentlemen who work there (I saw no ladies) are sociable, nice, happy, smiley, friendly, dudes. I was so pleased and impressed by that cause it can get stressful knowing all those people are waiting you know."
"10/20/18 Came here right when they opened up at 11:00 straight from the airport. Line was already about 30-40 people deep, but that didn't stop us from waiting. Weather was nice, not too hot. Water and sunscreen was provided. They even handed out some sausage samples. Delicious btw.

Almost 2hrs later, yes you heard right, it was time to order. We got the beef ribs (only sold on weekends) lean brisket(sold out of the fatty) pork ribs, and sausage. Got all 4 sides too.

Beef ribs - big portion (a little over a pound) a little fatty, falls off the bone, great smoke and season, but a little too salty for my taste.
Lean brisket - still tender, great smoke and seasoning.
Pork ribs - tender, great taste.
Sausage - delicious house made. Very lean. Barely any spiciness even though it had jalapeños in it.
Grits - tasty and cheesy.
Potato salad - very good, not too much mayo, good choice on using red potatoes.
Beans - very good. I was expecting like the ""traditional"" baked beans. But this was better! Pretty sure they use the trimmed ends of the brisket and cook it with the beans. Not sweet but savory.
Cole slaw - didn't try it. Not really a cole slaw guy but my friend liked it.
The bbq sauces they have is super good. Regular bbq, spicy bbq, and mustard sauce.

Staff was really friendly and helpful. They gave everyone in line updates on what they have and when they were starting to run low or run out of things. Even though it's pretty much just 2 Guys dishing out the food, one cutting the meats, and one dishing sides, they moved pretty quick once our order was placed. 

Even though the wait is long, it was worth it. Definitely enough time to decide what you want. Great bbq, great sides, great people. This place set the bar high for other bbq places I might try."
Great food great drinks aand would recommend highly to friends and fmaily..these giys were super awesome!
"In an attempt to not be repetitive, I was going to simply concur with most of the reports herein regarding Little Miss BBQ: delicious! However, all who know me also know it is next-to-impossible for me to be brief, so here goes!  

Note:  We did kind of decide to go here at the last minute, so were prepared for ""outages"", based on the feedback previously given.

1. Since we appreciate the decision to not serve warmed over meat, I was ok that there were no ribs, at that point. Sadly, though, the last pecan pie sold before we paid, so...I guess we will have to go back for that...another time. 

2. They ran out of pork as they were serving our plate, but compensated with more of the other meat. Brisket and pulled pork were flavorful, but not too smoky, tender, not dry, at all. We were given a sample of smoked turkey while standing in line; will definitely be trying that next time, as it was extremely flavorful and juicy. The homemade/bottled sauces are quite tasty and paired with the meat without overpowering the flavor.  Their mustard-based sauce is reminiscent of a Carolina style BBQ with a little more sweetness.

3.  Prices were quite reasonable based on our BBQ experience and the quality of the food.

4.  Cole slaw was OK; potato salad was not typical, but was tasty and potatoes were cooked well; the jalapeño cheese grits were excellent - and we are Southerners who know grits! 

5. Owner, his father, staff, and all others we came in contact with were friendly, welcoming, and helpful. That counts for a great deal. We strive to support local enterprises and appreciate their integrity.

6. We did experience a little wait, but there were misters along the line, and free cold water, so it wasn't too bad.  (And there was someone checking on the line and making conversation, which made you feel like you weren't forgotten, plus, we learned a little more about the business/owner.). The inside dining area is rather small, as we expected, so we sat outside; the misters and fans kept it from being too unbearable. 

We will return, and even looked into ordering for events in the future. 
GO to Little Miss BBQ. You will not regret it!"
"This is my favorite spot when traveling to Phoenix, and a hidden gem for BBQ Excellence

Be aware this play fills up and there is often a massive line that goes by quickly. The staff often brings samples to those in line. Also worth noting is that this place serves food till they run out so my advice is to come early."

"Every so often something lives up to the hype that precedes it.  Little Miss BBQ is one such instance. Recently went there for lunch and waited one hour before ordering. Initially, I thought, ""This is ridiculous. Why would anyone wait in line this long for barbecue?"" Glad I did because the beef brisket, the sausage, the ribs and everything else on the menu is outstanding. If Yelp allowed a six star rating, this restaurant would deserve it.

The staff is even better than the food. Outstanding, friendly customer service. One of the nice features about waiting in line is the staff regularly brings out samples of what's on the menu, and if you are a first timer, you are not going to believe how good the brisket tastes. It's like a big slab of butter put in your mouth. Never experienced better barbecue anywhere in the United States.

On the day I went, I was behind visitors from out of state and a new resident who had come from South Carolina. She was a repeat customer and raved about how good the barbecue was. Saying, ""this is the closest barbecue I've ever had to barbecue in the south or Texas.""

Don't forget to order the pecan pie if you like dessert. It is out of this world.

One final note. The lines are always long at Little Miss BBQ. They are open from 11 AM to 4 PM or until they run out of meat, which is almost every day because they are so busy. If you want to enjoy the best barbecue this side of the Mississippi, you should go early before they open and be one of the first people in line."
Best bbq in Phoenix! They serve both lean and fatty brisket and both taste absolutely amazing

"I have been going to LMB ever since they opened at the University Drive location. Absolutely the best Brisket in Arizona.

"My wife and I read about the great food available at Little Miss BBQ and arrived about 10:50 for their 11am opening. We got the last spot in the parking lot and had an hour and a half wait to get into the door to order our lunch. The outdoor temp. a little over 100 deg, on that Friday. Very hot wait, glad for the misters that they have for the covered line. We were offered water and samples of their sausage while in line which we gratefully accepted and was delicious. I wish we could give a rating for the food separately and the wait. The food was definitely 5 star. It was the brisket, both fatty and non-fatty that earned that rating. The sides were nothing to write home about. The staff was very friendly and helpful, can't say enough. The problem was the horrendously long wait. There is only one server cutting all of the meat for the patrons, while the subsequent staff waits to supply the sides, drinks and take the money.  That gets 2 stars. They need at least 3 servers cutting the meat, which would get the line down quickly. (It moves faster at Disneyland) The single meat server wouldn't be so bad, except for when a patron is ordering multiple meals to take back to the office, etc.which seems to be very frequently. So, the 2 stars for the long wait and the 5 stars for the food equates to an average of 3.5 stars. Until they figure out a way to move the line more quickly, I probably won't go back. Standing an hour and a half for food in the Phoenix heat just seems excessive."
"Unbelievable BBQ. Family run and the best in the southwest. The owner does the cooking and he takes full pride with his passion and does not slack when making this meat. Top notch food. 

I'm sure you've read it before so I will say it again. The wait time to get food is a good hour. Get there early because they run out of the good stuff early and close by 4pm.

Lastly drive a small vehicle. The parking lot is small and is tough to park a larger rig. 

Go eat here and savor every moment of it. 

The fatty brisket and the sausage are my favorites."
This place is soooo dope! My hubby was in Arizona for work and I made sure he went here and got the brisket and links. He was late for the ribs ..they were sold out. But the brisket is the bomb..so so so good!!! He bought some for me in the plane back to California! So happy!
"It's one of the best BBQ places in the world! Managed by great people who are all courteous and friendly, they make the experience of eating great BBQ even better.

While I understand why it takes so long, I really wish  they could find a way to expedite the line. Waiting an hour adds to the experience, but waiting 2-3 hours when the line doesn't appear that long is a bit frustrating. 

You can't rush perfection, and that's what it is, but sometimes the wait takes away from the incredible food.

Fatty brisket is where it's at, lean is good as well. I love the turkey and the sausage, but again everything is good. Can't go wrong with any of the sides and if they have the pecan pie, it's a must!

Love the people, love the food, don't love waiting 2hrs, but it just means I'll come less often, not stop coming at all, which I'm guessing is what they are counting on."
"Best bbq place, make sure to arrive early so you can get what you want and to avoide the long line, usually sale out quick"

"Holy mother of god why did it take me so long to go to Little Miss BBQ!

These yelp reviews don't lie. The wait was over an hour and it was super hot outside but it was worth it.

"As one other yelper said, "" I just waited in line for an hour to spend more $ than I usually would on BBQ, and I can't wait to do it again!""

You probably already know a bit about this place if you are even looking at my review, maybe you found it through the Yelp US Top 100 of 2014, maybe by way of newspaper, or publications from Texas to Phoenix raving about this place.  So I don't know there's much I can offer you to say at this point except do a quick rundown of my ratings on the individual parts of everything.

Service is 5+ stars.  The owner seriously cares about the success of the restaurant and the delivery of the food down to just making people happy in line.  His father also works at the restaurant talking to people in line (yes you'll wait anywhere from 40 minutes to an hour and a half) and he will be glad to show you the smokers, talk about the cooking process, and brag on his son (he has a right to!).  His dad also helps in the parking lot.  Yes, the parking is ultra cramped, and you can get towed if you park in the wrong spot (check with the parking attendant if you are unsure!).  Yes, you might have to wait to park.  Please let this deter you so that I don't have to wait so long in line next time ;)

The meats are all 5 stars to me.  They come unsauced - no cover up here, just great meat....  You can tell they are evenly cooked, ribs and brisket have that perfect little bit of bark on the outside and oh so juicy tender inside.  I had the turkey, fatty brisket, lean brisket, pork ribs.  All are 5 stars.  And let me tell you, I have eaten at dozens of BBQ joints from GA to California.  It really doesn't' get much better than this folks, and between my two visits and my friends and families 4-5 visits, it's consistently good, not just sometimes.

The Jalapeno grits are addicting.  I'm from GA, what a great addition to the BBQ side items.  5 stars here.

The slaw and other items are all 4.5 stars.  While great, they just aren't on my perfect 5 star radar.  

Getting an inside seat is really really luck of the draw.  They have outdoor seating under an awning as well next to the cookers.  It's possible you could wait in line all this time and not have a place to sit at the end - I haven't experienced this yet fortunately!  Oh and watch yourself strolling in at 3pm.  Some days, they are sold out of a lot of things by then.  The fatty brisket goes a lot sooner.

If you feel like giving, be sure to ask for the gift card to give someone, just make sure that you have room for the oak log gift certificate they hand you in return!"
"There's always a long line but it's well worth the wait!! The ribs, chopped brisket and Mac n cheese were so good and the sauces were fire!!! The only downside is they always run out of things."
"These guys are like the Soup Nazi from Seinfeld.The BBQ is OK but not anywhere near great.  They don't take ""to go"" orders. You just have to show up and hope they don't ""sell out"" before you get to buy the food.  So you show up at 4 and get in line and ""hope"" they still have some stuff to sell you before they ""sell out."" RIDICULOUS. Apparently the owners think it's a better idea to not have any leftover food so they just stop selling it when they run out.  A normal restaurant would serve people during their regular hours and accept the fact that they may actually have some waste at the end of the day, but not these folks.  Obnoxious, haughty attitude and very run-of-the-mill BBQ.  Never going back.  You can't even even order food to pickup unless it's 5 pounds of ribs or other meats. My prediction is that they will will fail eventually."
"I was aware of the warnings but didn't fully pay attention. Compared to my occasional 3pm weekend breakfasts, I was relatively diligent on my Little Miss BBQ excursion, but arriving just after the 11am opening time wasn't good enough. I waited about 1:40 and yet still didn't get the full experience, just missing the fatty brisket.

I got the lean brisket, chopped brisket and pork rib. The chopped was the best of these options, presumably hinting at some of the greatness of Little Miss BBQ's most elusive item. The beans were great and even the free pickles were good, and the pecan pie was a fine choice. I didn't get the pulled pork but it looked much more interesting than usual."

"Great barbecue. The ribs are especially soft, moist, and flavorful. Brisket is a little dry, but overall everything is delicious. The sauces and smoked pecan pie are worth coming back for anytime."
"OMG. What an excellent place for the most delicious bbq.  Everything was 5 star outstanding, you name it. From the service, the host ""Michael"" who came to speak to us when waiting in line, to the tour of the smokers and then finally the food. 

Ordered the fatty brisket, the meat to get here before it runs out and the sides jalapeño grits. The brisket was juicy, tender (melt in your mouth), great smoky flavors and delicious. The grits were were screams and very flavorful. 

Totally enjoyed the meal. There were 5 of us and everyone could not stop praising the food and the service. 

Friends got the pork ribs which were fall off the bone delicious!"
"Didn't expect great BBQ in Arizona, but this is it. Brisket was super moist. Long line, but food was worth it. Just make sure that you have an hour to wait for your food."
"""Love is a smoke made with the fume of sighs.""―William Shakespeare

Little Miss BBQ (LMB) has been on my radar since I first spotted the glowing Yelp reviews after my last trip to AZ; I saw the 5-star Yelp average, but figured it wouldn't hold up for long. Lo and behold, as I was researching places to eat on this trip LMB again entered my sights, and I was shocked to see that they had still held onto the 5-star avg and with well over 600 reviews! LMB had suddenly become a ""must go."" After reading some reviews I noticed that the crazy-long lines seemed to be a consistent pattern; my flight was scheduled to arrive at 10:20 a.m., and --seeing the close proximity of LMB to PHX-- I knew if we were on time, and moved quickly, we could be there before, or right when they opened. After landing, my Navy SEAL-like precision put us in line at approx 10:55 a.m.--5 min before opening, but the line was already about 30-40 folks deep. There are few things in this world I'll wait more than 20 min for, but 5-star BBQ is one of them. It took almost an hour to make it through, but it was worth every second...

Meat:

Pulled Pork- This might've been the most disappointing of all the meat here at LMB; the smoke was a bit muted, and the rub was lacking but it was still juicy. The lack of flavor was nothing a little sauce couldn't cure. 3*

Turkey- Surprisingly excellent Smoked Turkey! The meat was tender, juicy and just the right amount of smoke to not overpower the delicate flavor. Even my sister (the pickiest eater I know) loved it! 4.5*

Ribs- Amazingly tender, smoky and just the perfect amount of rub. No sauce needed for these bad boys. They were so friggin' good I ate the little cartilage pieces at the ends of the ribs... 0_o 5*

Fatty Brisket- My goodness... I can't even think of words to describe the heavenly experience that is eating LMB's Brisket. Smoky, Juicy, Beefy... Bah! Mere words cannot describe this humbling experience. All I'm going to say is it's better than my homemade version, and we'll leave it at that. 5* 

Sides:

Beans- I almost passed on the beans and got the 'slaw--until I talked to the guy serving up the meat and he told me they use the trimmings and juices from the brisket to make their beans! All I can say is, ""Wow..."" Seriously the best Bean side dish I've ever had at a Q joint. Smoky, beefy, slight sweetness and the beans were cooked to perfection. 5*

Jalapeño Cheddar Grits- Pretty good rendition of this classic southern dish. The texture of the grits was on point and plenty of cheese, but I felt like it could've used more jalapeño flavor. It was a bit muted and needed that kick! 3*

Bekke's Secret Pecan Pie- I'm not sure if the name is refers to the secret recipe, or that it's not listed on LMB's wall menu? Maybe both?! Regardless, it's still a pretty cracking Pecan pie! Not too sweet and a nice flaky crust make this a must-get! 4.5*

Service & Ambiance- Located in a mostly industrial area LMB's surroundings leave much to be desired, and their parking lot is waaaay too small to accommodate their popularity. However, there is plenty of street parking close-by. All the employees were terrific; friendly, good-natured--and not stingy on the goods!! 3*Ambiance/5*Service

Value- Pretty standard high BBQ pricing, but their giant servings make you feel like you're getting a good deal. 4*

My only qualm with LMB is their wait times, as you really do need to sacrifice about two hours of time between the waiting and the eating. And that's not to mention if you wanted some Q in the AZ summer! If I lived in the area this would --unfortunately-- be a weekend only experience. So, other than the wait, LMB gets a rare 5-star BBQ review from me. Highly, highly recommended!!!"
Tried this today and all the hype is real. Easily some of the best bbq I've ever had. Get there early or you risk losing out. Line can start as early as 9am for tickets. Beef ribs and fatty brisket go first. Pork ribs and pulled pork are my  favorites.  We waited in line for an hour and it was worth every minute. Highly recommend!

"It was tough coming up with the rating for little miss bbq but I'd put it around a 3.5. The bbq overall is pretty good, but it isn't somewhere I would frequent due to the amount of time spent waiting outside.

Favorites - fatty brisket, pastrami, pecan pie. The brisket really does melt in your mouth and is some of the best I've had, although can be a bit salty. The pecan pie has a perfectly flaky crust, and the pie is not overly sweet and has great flavor. 

Others - pastrami has great flavor but is a bit dry  lean brisket is fine, but definitely needs some sauce as it is also dry. Pork ribs were fine but salty, and I didn't want to eat more than one. Sausage is also fine but nothing special, and wouldn't order again. 

As for sides, the potato salad is fresh and delicious. The jalapeño cheddar grits are also good but pretty standard. And the beans were creamy and rich. 

Overall, the bbq was good but I'd really only come back for the fatty brisket and pecan pie. And I wouldn't wait over an hour outside for it."

"First meal in Phoenix and it was a winner!! BF yelped this place as we were driving in from Sedona, and I'm glad we came! There was a short line when we arrived around 1pm on a Wednesday, but we waited about 20-30 minutes before placing our order.

FOOD:
The two of us being piggies, ordered: the two meat plate - chopped brisket and pulled pork (they were out of brisket), two pork ribs (they gave us a complimentary end cut of the ribs!), a sausage, with jalapeno cheese grits and ranch style beans PLUS all the fixings. Whew, that was a mouthful. We pretty much ate everything except for a few bites of meat that we took home and it was all DELICIOUS. The sides were delicious, meat was super tender, super flavorful and went well with the sauces. The spicy house sauce was my favorite.

Everyone at Little Miss is super friendly, super helpful and overall just great people. There's seating inside and outside and bathrooms so you can wash your hands afterwards as well. Parking lot right next to the space.

Would definitely come back!"
"It's hard to separate the food from the experience. I understand that are opening a new place, and possibly that will change the experience at this original location. 

I try barbeque everywhere I go. And I've had some really amazing bbq. And usually I get my food within 5-15 minutes of entering a place. If it's super busy and there's a wait I'm still eating within an hour and eating what I went there for. 

This place is incredibly popular and incredibly inefficient. What that translated to for me was being there over an hour before opening and standing in line for nearly 3 hours, only to have the last of the sliced wet brisket sold to the people right in front of me. 

The people working there are very friendly, Michael certainly did his best to entertain and to provide updates and explanations of what was going on. But I can guarantee you that I'll never go there again unless I hear the wait has dropped significantly. 

Parking is difficult at best. Standing for 3 hours is tiring and makes it hard to appreciate the experience at all. 

And I've had better bbq.

If the new place is promising on efficiency I'll give it a try."

"We came here all the way from the OC, it was truly the first stop we made in Phoenix and was the best way to start our weekend. This place opens at 11 and there will be a line forming on weekends an hour before. We got here around 10:15 and there was a good 15 people in line already. After parking your car, remember to get a ticket in order to save your spot in line. A little before they open, they'll have everyone stand up and get in line in the order of your ticket. From where we were, we waited about another 45 min before getting to order. The customer service here is beyond phenomenal,m. There was a gentleman walking around and managing the parking situation who comes to greet everyone. He will make small talk with you and walked around giving everyone water as it was 110 degrees and you're standing outside. The service inside isn't any different, from the gentleman cutting the meat to the cashier, everyone treats you so well and makes sure you're happy before you leave. 

The bbq here was just top notch, we had fatty brisket, sausages, some pork & some pork ribs. They supply white bread and pickles for you as well. The fatty brisket ran out around 12:30pm...an hour and a half after opening. And there was a good reason why, the brisket it smoked perfectly, with such great flavor and the meat just pulls apart. The sausages were good as well, not the best part of the dish but certainly not bad. The pork ribs were a bit thinner then normal which is why we were given a little more. They were fantastic and pulling them off the bone was amazing."
"The fatty brisket was far better than what I could have imagined. The sharp smokiness in the same bite as the juicy fat. My mouth is watering just thinking about it again. Although this joint started serving about an hour after the time listed on Yelp, I certainly understand why. They stay true to their craft and stick to the high standard they have set for themselves. I tried most of the meats on the menu and they were all great. But the clear star has to be the fatty brisket. It drives me crazy just thinking about it. The sides were also quite delicious. The grits made for a stable carb base while the meaty beans offered a little extra depth in flavor. The best bite was when you ate everything together: meat, sides, and their signature sauces. It offered variety in taste palate and made the food so much more interesting. If you're in the area, be sure to check this place out. But beware, I heard that they're known to run out of meat later on in the day."
"This BBQ is literally as good as it gets. I have seen reviews complaining about the food, but seriously, they sell out. There is a line every day which begins forming an hour before they open. By the time they open you feel lucky if you're in the top 20 in line. At that, it will be an hour before you're served. Why? Because they're THAT good! 

I thought about asking a few people if I could take cuts; they knew I had my car running with my dog in it when I arrived at 10:15am. Once the doors opened and the real wait began, and seeing what others were ordering, and me, being from 100 miles away, my order changed from a pound of brisket to 3 pounds of brisket. People in front of me had pages of lists of orders for their workplace, etc. I knew I wouldn't be back for a long, long time and 3 pounds was what I could afford.

Their meats are exceptional! The service is fast and courteous. Yes, it's fast considering the orders being placed. I was impressed that I was out of there by noon with my prized brisket in-hand. 

There is a long wait for a reason. There is a reason they sell out. Anything less than 5 star reviews should really be considered as I see complains of them running out or the wait time. These things happen because they are that great! Nothing less than 5-stars! I could complain they're an hour away, but that doesn't keep them from selling out every, single day!"

Food -

I always wanted to try this place but I can't ever see myself waiting in line to try it again.  Won't give them a chance to do this to me again.

I'm not a big fan of BBQ but the pastrami and brisket were so good !! I didn't even need a knife to cut it into pieces. Using a fork and just twisting it on the meat breaks it right off. "Damn this place!  So much wrong that makes it oh so right. 

I'll start with the line. When I got there just after noon (my bad) I was about the 30th person in line and, damn, the line moved soooooooo slow. In the first half hour I saw maybe a dozen people come out of the place of worship. But, to be honest, it builds the anticipation. By the time I got to just outside the door I was like a kid trying to peak in the circus tent and like Ralphie planning to tell Santa he wanted a Red Rider BB gun, I had practiced and practiced my order. '1 pound of pork ribs to go, double meat plate, lean brisket (they were already out of the fatty brisket as apparently it's their holly grail) and sausage for here with ranch beans and potato salad'.

I got up to the Willie Wonka of meat and actually nailed my order. So proud I didn't crack under the pressure.  Out the door I went with my meat cornucopia to the crappy outside seating area. 

Now the next chapter; the food. I went straight to the brisket and found religion!  The skies parted and the angels sang. I can only imagine the orgasmic experience their fatty brisket must be like (do I have that name right?).  The sausage and ranch beans were exceptional as well. The potato salad.....well not everything can be the best I've had. I'm not a big fan of BBQ sauce believing the meat should not need it to be a quality product. That said, I'd put their house regular sauce on cardboard and happily eat it. 

Okay, this has been long enough! I'll end by saying the pork ribs I had for dinner after I got home, possibly the best I've ever had. One last thing; don't forget the pecan pie, out-stand-ing!"

"This place is amazing. And really, amazing doesn't seem like nearly strong enough of a word. 

The hubs and I were in Phoenix for a wedding, staying at the airport Hilton. I looked up what food was around there and came across this mysterious place. We had absolutely nothing to do on Friday when our flight got in just before 10AM so we came on over. There were probably about 25 or 30 people in front of us, but we got a parking spot in the lot and got in line. It was still the middle of September, so it was pretty freaking hot out. At first the hubs and I were just taking it all in, looking at the gorgeous set up they have, and drinking as much water as possible. 

As time went on, we started to talk to strangers and get a little more information about Little Miss. We talked to a few members of their incredibly friendly and informative staff as well as a few return patrons. Really, the line was painless, we were in the shade with plenty of water and friendly people. 

Well, it turns out it was a good idea to make friends with the guy in front of us. He bought the last of the fatty brisket, but let us get enough for our order! We also tried the pulled pork, a sausage, and a giant beef short rib. The short rib and fatty brisket were my favorite. The hubs barely got any of the short rib because I was so obsessed with it. They have good sauce, but it's not necessary at all. 

Bottom line: Come early, drink lots of water, be friendly, order everything."
"Great atmosphere, feels like a good ol backyard get together. Friendly staff. The pulled pork tastes like magic. Amazing turkey. Excellent sauces."
"We arrived on a (hot) Friday at 10:30am and ordered at 11:40. Their parking lot holds ~30 cars, but it was full by 11:15. Most early arrivals dined in, but a couple people made to go orders, intermittently freeing up spots before the first diners left. When we left around 12:45, there were ample spots open.

Meats:
-Our favorite was definitely the pork rib - the meat slipped off the bone, and it was super juicy.
-The beef short rib (an absolute unit) had a flavor that reminded me of peppery beef jerky. The giant bone helped retain moisture in the meat, and the flavor was wonderful.
-Next came the fatty brisket. I thought the brisket was above above average but didn't think it fully live up to the hype - the fatty portion on top was great, but the bottom portion was carried by the top half.
-Pulled pork was also fantastic. We tried some turkey, which was extremely Smokey and delicious on turkey standards, but definitely outshone by the previous 3. Sausage was also good - loved that snappy casing.

Sides: We didn't get the cole slaw, but got single orders ($2.50 each) of the grits, baked beans, and potato salad. Grits were the favorite (super creamy), then the potato salad (clean cubes in a non mayo-y sauce), then the baked beans (I'm partial to sweeter baked beans, but these still weren't bad). Complimentary toppings included some superb pickles, as well as pickled jalapeños and sliced white onion. The white bread they give prevents more room for meat in your tummy, but definitely helps digestion later on. Sauces were all great too!

Everyone is seriously SO nice. We were constantly offered water to stay hydrated, and even after sitting down to eat, were given water by a circulating pal. The meat master was friendly and helpful, as were the sides sorcerer and cashier commander.

Logistics/misc:
- Beef short ribs only on Friday and Saturday
- Pastrami on Thursdays
- Lots of outdoor picnic tables, and indoor seating has 5 tables of four
- They say the heat will deter people from coming, but not really the case so don't expect a shorter line by any means 
- If you're worried about waiting outside, they have ample shade, misters, and water to keep you alive (I thought the wait flew by, but maybe that was just me).
- Also, I ate a ridiculous amount of meat, didn't eat anything for the rest of the day, and I have what feels like a hangover nearly 12 hours later...but it's all good!!

This trip was totally worth it, and I will be back!"
"I wish I could give them 10 stars!! I kind of don't want the word to get out that this is the best BBQ in Arizona, maybe the Western United States,  but the wait times are already an hour+ long everyday, so I guess the word is out. Great staff too!!"
"This place is the bomb! I'm from Ga, and I've always said that i can't find someone that makes better BBQ than I do, with my arsenal of 4 different types of grills. I stand corrected. "TLDR; this place is amazing not only for their food but also their customer service. Be sure to try the fatty brisket and the pecan pie. 

We went Saturday morning of Presidents Day weekend so I thought it would be more crowded than usual. But when we got there at 9AM to reserve our spot in line, there was no one. We ended up being fifth! You get the option to leave and come back later once you get a line ticket. If you do, just be back by 10:30AM. We decided to just stay in the parking lot since a lot of reviews said the parking lot gets full.

The line system pretty much works like Southwest Airlines. There are markers along the wall and fence that say which numbers should be at that point and about how long it will take from there to front. At the front of the line, there's a rock stacking game for your chance at a free pecan pie! 

When it was finally our turn to order, they gave us samples of the fatty brisket and the sausage. We ended up ordering double meat plates and a pecan pie. It's a first-come-first-serve seating with an indoor and outdoor seating area. 

Fatty brisket: SO GOOD. Honestly, it's so well seasoned that you don't really need to add any extra sauce, which you can. They have their own in-house sauce that's really good. The meat was so tender and the fat wasn't too overwhelming. 

Pulled pork: This was just alright to me. Some pieces were a bit dry but dipping it in their BBQ sauce made it better. 

Pecan pie: SO GOOD TOO. Not overly sweet and the crust was crunchy and buttery. 

I would definitely come back if I'm back in town. I wouldn't risk coming late though. I've heard the waits could go up to 3 hours. And once they run out of food for the day, they close shop!"
We stopped in here today before our flight back to San Francisco. I had the best pulled pork sandwich that I have ever had. What's more impressive is the service. Every worker was outgoing and friendly. They went above and beyond to make us feel at home. I have three boys and they made them sandwiches and milk--for free. I will 100% stop in here every time I'm in PHX!
"Great FOOD, enough said. I don't have to say much but it's EVERYTHING. The lines are long, but moves quick."
"Get here early! By 9 AM. Yes, I know they say they open at 11 AM. If you want BBQ you must sacrifice your time and come hungry! You could bring your own beverages, but Little Miss will provide cold bottles of water while you wait in the covered patio. That is very nice and generous of them to make sure we are not parched and prevent us from passing out in the desert heat. 

I haven't had Texas style BBQ in awhile since I move away from the Lone Star state. So, I was very excited for some smokey, buttery, fatty, and juicy Brisket!

The most amazing place for bbq in Phoenix. Get there at 11 or 4. Go on Thursday for the pastrami. You're welcome. Special things daily. Full bar great food. Get there early.
"Just reaffirming my former 5-star review with some added items that I tried recently.

Ordered the brisket and pastrami plate.  The bark on the pastrami is crazy.  Thick, salty, peppery.  In terms of tenderness, it is on par with Katz's pastrami in NYC.  It is saltier than theirs.  On its own, the saltiness was a little much.  But eating it with the potato salad or white bread mellowed the seasoning and you're just able to enjoy the tender, moist goodness of the beef.  

The fatty brisket that I ordered along with it was, again, amazing.  

I also ordered the smoked pecan pie.  Get it.  Get it now.  Get it to go.  It is, I believe, one of the best pecan pies I've had in my life.  The crust is flaky and buttery and hold up to the flavor of the filling.  The filling is sweet but not sickeningly sweet like in other pecan pies.  It's sticky without being over-heavy.  The pecans on the pie add great texture are excellent on their own.  This is a world class pecan pie.  

Also had the sausage for the first time.  Love it.  Nice, thick casing.  A crazy snap when you bite or cut into it.  Just enough jalapeno to make it interesting.  It is thick and juicy and porky.  Another superlative dish from a superlative establishment."

"Items Selected:
Sliced Fatty Brisket, Pulled Pork, Jalapeno Cheddar Grits, Ranch Style Beans
Spicy Pork + Beef and Onion Sausage, Bone-in Pork Ribs, 1lb Beef Rib, Coleslaw, Potato Salad
Smoked Pecan Pie

Said by many to be Texas-standard, words rarely thrown-around lightly by respectable sources, it was minutes past 10:00am that the car was parked a stone's throw from Sky Harbor Airport, the line at Little Miss BBQ already twenty-deep and soon to swell well past two-hundred before the restaurant's doors opened up.

Spawned from the world of Competition BBQ, one of the owners' Austin-roots infusing the team with passion and perspective no different from the Franklins and Muellers of the world, Little Miss BBQ represents the dream of Scott and Bekke Holmes - a Pitmaster with a culinary degree and his wife who has helped both as inspiration and in the kitchen.

Opened in February of 2014, patrons and accolades flooding the industrial storefront ever since, a trip to Little Miss BBQ will be immediately familiar to those who've dined at Texas' best, the wood piles rimming the parking lot ready to be loaded into an offset smoker straight from Texas, the laminated outdoor menu promising everything from sliced Brisket, pulled Pork and Turkey to jumbo Beef Ribs.

One-upping many from the Lone-star State by making their spicy-Sausage on-site, samples whetting appetites as a young server circulated the line a few minutes before their eleven o'clock opening, it was precisely as the minute-hand reached 12 that the line lurched forward, several far-back letting out a small cheer even though they would spend yet another hour in anticipation.

Perhaps a bit more packed than usual, the week between Christmas and New Year's plus a Fiesta Bowl crowd making a long weekday lunch more accessible to some, it was on approach of the counter that the crowd watched meats unloaded from the smoker get wrapped in foil or butcher paper, the moist Protein again revealed by Chef Holmes in a slow and methodical manner as orders are placed, each tray or plate lined and tared as he smiles and thanks fans while handing out small bites and occasional burnt-ends to those most fortunate.

Keeping the menu simple, Meats by the pound or combo-plates featured alongside four Sides, classic Condiments and one Dessert, it was to a grand tally of $54 that nearly four pounds of Barbeque plus one of each side was taken to an indoor table, glasses of water filled from an outside cooler with three housemade Sauces ready in waiting.

Struck by the humble vibe, but not about to waste anymore time before tucking into the Fatty Brisket that Scott's knife had glided through like Butter, comparisons to Aaron Franklin immediately became apparent as the peppery bark gave way to pure decadence, the prime-grade Beef more than juystifying its cost, as does the sizable Cow Rib with such a deep ring of smoke that it barely adhered to the bone beneath it.

More impressed by the warm sides than chilled ones, spicy Grits as smooth as they get while Pinto Beans are upgraded by a substantial amount of Meat, Little Miss BBQ's pulled-Pork and Spare-Ribs are also as good as the majority found outside Kansas City, the latter slipping cleanly from the bone with each made even better by the restaurant's Tomato-based Hot Sauce while Bekke's Pecan Pie made a believer of even someone who claims not to enjoy such things, the smoked top-layer of Nuts helping to mellow a Maple and Brown Sugar Jam bottom."
"Having lived in North Carolina and having visited Kansas City, I Did not see some of the best BBQ I've ever had coming from Phoenix, Arizona. Every bite deserved 5 stars.

One negative. There is no cornbread."
"Alright this place is the real deal.  Stumbled on this place while watching water polo at ASU.  Being from Texas - always have high expectations for BBQ.  Brisket was off the hook: moist, perfect amount of smoky oak, perfectly cooked (not crumbling but fork tender).  Pork ribs were beautifully cooked with lots of meat and loosely pull from the bone.  Beans were awesome.  Note to owner: need two people chopping and serving to move the line quicker.

It was about 1 1/2hr wait but well worth it."
"Little Miss BBQ

Is this the ""best barbecue""? That's a very subjective term. Is it better than that place on the highway outside Asheville I stopped at a couple years ago? Is it better than that family-run place in Waco from 15 years ago? Don't recall. Don't care. Got stuff at the end of the day by scoping the place out the day before (they hadn't run out by 4 PM; they apparently run out on the weekends). The lunchtime wait is usually 20 people, and we didn't have the time at lunchtime.
So how is it? Well, the potato salad was pretty good, smoked pecan pie I might call that the best pecan pie ever. Pickles nice and tart. But the brisket with house sauce; excellent. The house sauce is a tiny bit spicy, with a great tomato base flavor. The chopped brisket is tender (without being mushy), juicy, flavorful, and appropriately fatty. I mean the place ain't big or fancy; probably best to get food to go. The folks are really friendly and one can tell take pride in offering what - to this New Englander - is certainly one of the best barbecue in recent memory. Oh, and I sampled the ""cheesy jalapeño grits"" yesterday. Those are hands-down the best grits evah."
"Absolutely AMAZING! Best BBQ ever! Smoked brisket (both lean & fatty), cut the way you want.  Sides were equally amazing. I didn't feel like the sauces (table side) were anything super special, but honestly, they weren't needed. In addition to the amazing brisket, pork, turkey, etc., is an exceptional staff. Some of the nicest folks you'll ever meet. And while you're waiting in line for your order, they provide samples along with complimentary water. Be sure to go early (before they open) or you're looking at quite the wait and potentially them running out of your favorites. People will come place orders of 20+ sandwiches ""to go""."
"Not going to lie I dig this place a lot and it's not just because of the very very very say it three times for emphasis cute lady who takes your order. The food is great, always like a place where you can go in order something for ten bucks and I walk away and be like I think I'm good for meals for the rest of the day. Like it doesn't have that quick barbecue feel that you would get from I don't know ordering it from one of those fast food joints actually taste like they did it on a slow cooker or the meats fresh and all of that not coming from some frozen area. I love going there during lunch grab it real quick usually I'll grab a protein drink for dinner because I'm still very full. "I came to Little Miss BBQ based on a recommendation from another BBQ restaurant owner.  He was telling me about how this BBQ Team beat him and several other regional competition BBQ Teams in a recent contest.  He said they had cooked some of the best brisket he's had in a long time.  

Well, he's right.  They have excellent BBQ brisket!  It doesn't last long after they open, so you'll need to get their early.  I did try everything else and found it all to be very good.  Their pulled pork was average compared to some other BBQ places around Phoenix, but their ribs, smoked sausage and their brisket were awesome.  I like their jalapeño grits a lot and their potato salad as well.  

They are located in this very little place however they do have some seating set up outside.  With the cooler weather of winter in Phoenix, dinning outside is very nice!  Writing this review is making me hungry for some Little Miss BBQ!  I'm most certainly looking forward to my next visit and I hope to see you there!"
Visiting Arizona. Great food. Friendly staff. Clean restaurant. Plenty of parking. Good prices. Beans amazing. Meat tender and full of flavor.
"Of course this place has 5 stars, how could it not? It's the best BBQ around, not just AZ but better than Texas and N. Carolina! Yeah, I said it. Fight me! The waits are long and they sell out around lunchtime but they make sure to pass out samples as you wait and provide bottled water when standing in line in the summer. Seriously THE BEST."
This is literally the best bbq place I have been to in my life. The line is always incredibly long (1 hour plus) but I think it has been worth it every time I've gone.  You really can't go wrong with anything that you order and they will give you samples and recommendations when you are in line. If you are hungry I would recommend getting the pecan pie. It is the best. Parking is not surprisingly difficult but they make it work.
"Unfortunately they were out of pulled pork and the sausage by the time we got there at 2 pm. Fortunately the brisket was the best I've ever had. I got the sliced brisket sandwich and it was loaded with slices of brisket. It was tender and the peppered crust added just the right kick. Husband had the chopped brisket sandwich and they don't include that peppery crust in the chopped brisket so not quite as flavorful. Tried the three sauces offered and they all were delicious. Coleslaw was good, jalapeño cheese grits were a little flat. Could have used more jalapeños. They suggested we get there at 10:15 am (they open at 11 am) if we want to be sure to get what we want. Line starts forming even before that."
"Wow, wow, wow! So the hype is real. The weather is cooling off and I decided to commit to standing in line early to beat the LMBBQ rush. Well worth the 1.5hour wait. I took a huge order to-go and tried everything on the menu because I didn't want to leave any stone un-turned. Everything and I mean, everything was exceptional. I'm a meats&potatoes kinda girl and I was impressed with the badly, smoky flavor packed fatty brisket so much I found myself wishing I had ordered even more. 
Seasoned to perfection."
What can I say but... The greatest barbecue I've ever had! And the customer service is always outstanding.
"Wow! Just wow! I have been to quite a few BBQ places in my life and this one is right up on top. This place not only takes pride in customer service, they are very proud of what they serve as well as they should be. 
BBQ is a tough one to get just right... let alone perfect. 
I will definitely be returning and suggest you all do the same. Worth the effort."
''This place is pure torture if you get in line starving!!! It feels like your in a prison camp watching people bring out their chosen last meal!!!
"Worth the wait. The fatty brisket was so delicious, totally worth arriving an hour before so you don't have to risk the kitchen running out of meat.  The sides weren't bad either, the bake bean has so much meat in it, grits was amazing, as well as the potato salad. Service there was very friendly."
"Long wait but well worth it. The staff are beyond friendly; boisterous & affable. They ran out of a few things which probably saved our waistlines, but the lean brisket, chopped brisket, pulled pork, beans & coleslaw were all wonderful. The whole family was making yummy noises in the car while we scarfed it down. (It was 114° outside so the AC was warranted.)

Can't imagine how good the fatty brisket must be based on what we had."
"I love me some bbq, so when a coworker told me about this place, I had to check it out while I was in town. I was warned ahead of time that there would be a line, that they have a limited amount of everything, and that they close whenever they run out. I headed here right away after I dropped my bags at the hotel (which I booked because of it's close proximity). Shortly after getting in line, an employee came out and announced that the fatty brisket (my go to bbq) was gone for the day, and that the pulled pork and ribs were almost gone. Fortunately, I didn't get shut out. Despite my preference for fattier brisket, this might be the best brisket I've ever had. The ribs were also fantastic, and the sausage was very good too. The beans, and cole slaw were very good. My only knocks on the place is their side options aren't plentiful, and the bbq sauces are good but not great in my opinion. Also, there are only about 5 tables that are big enough for 4 people, so seating may be tough. The service was awesome, and the staff were all extremely friendly and welcoming though!  I'll definitely be back!"
Best BBQ ever. I would wait all day for this experience again. Staff was also super friendly and made the whole experience even better.
"Great food, all that for 18 bucks , I took half home for dinner later. The staff is great and friendly you can ask any question and they'll answer it for you, they're always handing out samples, great place to take an  out of town guests."
"I cannot say enough about Little Miss Bbq. The staff was so gracious and friendly. We arrived at 10:15 and were given tickets so we could wait in the car with ac until 10:40 when we were asked to line up according to ticket numbers. It was hot waiting in line, but they had chairs, water, misters, and samples. The doors opened at 11:00 and I would say we ordered by 11:20.

The food was amazing! Well worth the wait in the 105 degree heat!! I will be back next time we are in Phoenix."
"You wanna talk about commitment?
Me and my boyfriend drove at 2:30am from Los Angeles to get to Little Miss in Phoenix at exactly 9:30am on a Thursday to be one of the firsts in line (we were the 4th and 5th people). We were supposed to be in Phoenix for the weekend for a friend's birthday, but we came a FULL DAY earlier JUST so we could have time to wait for Little Miss in the morning. Like we paid for a whole 'nother AirBnb mostly so we could have our precious Little Miss bbq again. If that's not love (for meat), I'm not sure what is. 

This was our second time and it was just as amazing as the first. There's a ticket system now, which is amazing because it means you can hold your place in line without actually needing to stand in line (you can chill in your car or drive somewhere else before they officially open @ 11). 

Be warned that there's a lot of mosquitos while you wait because of the fertilizer in the plants, but they hand out free samples and free water while you wait in line, which is awesome.

Hands down, some of the best customer service I've ever experienced. The staff at the counter are so friendly and they try to make conversation with all of their customers. They look like they genuinely enjoy their jobs and it's just such a happy environment to be in. They'll put you in such a good mood. Tip these people well!

Now, the food. We tried:

- Fatty brisket - AMAZING. Literally the star of the show and all everyone ever talks about. This thing is DRIPPING with juices and contains so much flavor. 

- Pork ribs - literally falls off the bone. My second favorite. 

- Turkey (seasonal) - I only had a bite of this but it was probably some of the best turkey I've ever had. I wish my turkeys tasted like this on Thanksgiving. Seasonal menu item, so snag some while you can. 

- Jalapeño cheese grits - My favorite side. It's creamy with the smallest kick from the jalapeños. The perfect muted companion to all the flavorful meats. 

- Country beans - BF's fave. Also cooked with meat and has a robust, almost-smoked flavor.

- Pecan pie - as amazing as they say. The pie is the perfect mini size for 1-2 people and the inside is soft and delectably sweet. I almost got the seasonal pumpkin Nutella pie, but decided on the pecan since it's a classic and was recommended to me by a server over it. It was kinda a hard decision but I have 0 regrets.

Side note, the spicy sauce is everything. You must get it even if you're not into spice because it's amazing.

All of this food was around $50 to feed both my bf and I and it was worth every penny tbh. It was able to feed us for the entire day (breakfast, lunch, and dinner) since the portions are so filling. Just take my money, you deserve it.

I'm literally a walking advertisement for Little Miss at this point, but the point is that this place is bbq heaven on earth."
"I lived in the South for 6 years. Also still travel their weekly for both work and pleasure. So I love great BBQ. If you're looking for sold spot in Phoenix, Little Miss BBQ delivers!

The food is fantastic as are the various sauce options. I especially recommend the brisket, pulled pork, or pork ribs for your meat selection. The portion sizes can be hefty, so the food is best enjoyed with a friend.

The service has always been great, and the staff super kinds. The only downside was the wait. But they supply water and keep you cool with their misting system in the meantime.

If you're in need of a great BBQ place near the airport, I highly recommend you try this place."
"I wish I could give this place 6 stars! The food is beyond belief. The guys who serve it are amazing too but the food. The food! The brisket is THE best I've ever had. I actually saw a guy get shivers of delight tasting it. The meat melts in your mouth and takes you to heaven. 

I've tried almost everything there. Just need to go back for lamb and sausage now. But I'll wait till after Easter. The line there is usually a long wait (but worth it!). I can only imagine how crazy it'll be this close to the holiday. 

How good is this stuff? Let's put it this way: I live 45 minutes away and would happily go back and stand in line. :D"

"I just wasn't in the mood to cook a turkey this year and someone recommended Little Miss BBQ to pre-order, in the Yelp Community chat.

First of all customer service is top-notch, they are super responsive to their Facebook messages and email and even called to confirm my order and answered all my questions. 

I was worried about getting a smoked turkey because my only experience with one was getting it at the State Fair which usually disappoints me, but I was promised by the staff that there's is done right and it will forever change my mind.

Well they lived up to their promise and we can't wait to come in and try some of the other items soon. It was well worth the hour-long wait to see my husband's smiling face as he devoured his turkey leg this year!

Thanks for saving our Thanksgiving!"
"Finally tried them. Got there at 330 on a Wednesday, all they had left was brisket.
Brought a pound home and it was luscious!!!

"Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink):
1 star:  Never again.
2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back.
3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad.
4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return.
5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.

Just another 5-star review.

You already know this place is awesome, I'm just here to affirm you and your feelings.

Have traveled the South and Texas and everywhere in-between for good BBQ.  One meat in particular.  The brisket here is the best in Arizona.  Hands down.  It is also, one of the best in the nation.  Texas-style BBQ done right is a glorious thing, and the brisket shows it off best.  The brisket here is a revelation.

The pork ribs are smoky and peppery and also delicious.  The pulled pork is also superlative.  The sausages are very good, I'm still deciding if the sausages down in Texas are that much better than this place.

One note about ribs.  People talk about ""fall off the bone"" tender, but the best ribs do NOT fall off the bone upon picking up the rib or with the touch of a fork.  The best ribs come off the bone easily when you bite into it, but still have texture and chew.  The best ribs are not the perfect food for your toothless 80-year-old grandpa.  These are some of the best ribs - texture and taste as a handy food on a stick.

They don't muck up your order by pre-saucing, but their sauces are tasty.  They give you white bread.  (Only sliced white bread for Texas BBQ.)  They give you a little piece of brisket when you're waiting in line and you almost orgasm from that.

Best BBQ in AZ.  One of the best in the nation.  

OK fine, parking sucks when it's busy.  There's your criticism."
"I grew up in Texas and find that outside of the lonestar state I am usually disappointed by brisket or just bbq in general, but I have to say Little Miss BBQ's brisket is as good as any I've ever had! Perfect clean smokey taste, nice and tender with perfectly rendered fat and a substantial bark. Come here and you won't be disappointed. The sausage was good as well and I really enjoyed the jalapeño cheddar grits on the side. Will be back to try more of their meats, but don't skip the fatty brisket if you are coming here for the first time!"

"Beware, this is the kind of place that makes you stand in line just because they can.  What should have been a 10 minute wait turned into 45 because of deliberate slow service.  

There is a single person cutting meat, who insists on putting everything back into a warmer after serving each customer.  If only they utilized their staff properly, and had multiple people preparing food (instead of standing around and managing the line)

"So if one comes when they open on a cloudy Friday - be prepared to wait. But the wait is oh-so-incredibly worth it. This is, by far, the very best BBQ I have ever had in my entire life. Sure it isn't cheap, nor should it be - you pay for meat, dedication, patience, meat and effort. And meat.

I got the short tour while waiting from some knowledgeable gentleman. It was interesting. I will just go by what I tasted. 

* Lean brisket - very very good. 
* Fat brisket - absolutely amazing. (And I don't like fat meats)
* Sausage - tasty

* Beans - quite good
* Potato salad - meh, my moms blows this potato salad out of the water
* Grits - I didn't have the guts to try it. Next time. 

* House BBQ sauce - very nice
* House Hot BBQ sauce - nice w a strange kick to it.

It is all outside, yet shaded seating. Most people seem to take theirs to go though. 
These guys have changed the way I view BBQ from now on. I am a changed man. Their product (meat) is fantastic, their business approach could be improved. But I am only here to rate the best BBQ I have ever tasted to date in my life. There is nothing more to say. 7 stars for the meat, -2 for the wait and the basics of everything."
"As advertised. Great. Get there at 10:30 and be prepared to wait. I suggest buying a few 1/2 pounds of various options to bring home for another day.

"Brisket: other reviewers were accurate. Soft and melt in mouth but too much salt. Couldn't eat it 

Pork ribs: melt in mouth definitely good. 

Chopped brisket: not as fatty. Could be a mix. Not juicy either. Best to eat it freshly sliced or else the fat oozes out and the meat dries out. If you order to go get a big chunk and slice it yourself later. Every time I order sliced it dries out  and isn't even close to being as good as freshly sliced 

Sausage: ok, wouldn't order it again. 

They have many different sauces all similar to other places seeet maybe spicy

They have one sliced in the front and each customer takes 2-3 mins to order, make small talk, pay, ask questions. A line of 20 means an hour wait. Other reviewer was accurate in stating they could have more slicers to make it go faster. 

Bbq is hot now because of the press fr Aaron Franklin. One day this will all die off. 
Parking hard because the wait times are so long. They have coolers of ice water in the line. Definitely needed."
"Definitely amazing bbq. I have yet to visit this place in person but trying the take out order and even after it cooling down a bit, I could still taste the quality of this bbq. The sauces were excellent and flavorful. Brisket was phenomenal. Would definitely need to come by in person soon to try it fresh out of the kitchen!"
"This was my first time visiting LMB, and even before pulling into their smaller-than-expected parking lot at noon, I knew I'd be in for a wait.  I had read a review that mentioned a 90 minute line, however, I didnt expect to actually wait 90 minutes.

The parking lot holds about 20 cars, and I grabbed the last open spot.  There were about 30 people ahead of me in line, so I mistakenly anticipated 30-45 minutes.

The employees were friendly and accommodating!  They came out several times to prepare us for the items that would most likely be sold out by the time we arrived at the counter.  They brought water, and had several camping chairs to ease the burden of the slow moving line, and boy, was it slow moving.

They were sold out of the moist brisket, pulled port and beef ribs by the time I was able to place my order.  My meal, which consisted of chopped brisket and pork ribs was ok.  Truthfully, I would have been much happier waiting 10 minutes at Rudy's, which I think is just as good.  So 3 stars seems fair for what I got vs the time spent in line."
"Wow. Fatty brisket is the bomb ! Brought me back to Texas. Pork rib very good, but the brisket.....worth the trip  and wait alone. Super friendly service."
"Be prepared to wait, best believe is the best out there. I was told about this place and they didn't disappoint. Be there early as to find parking. There's a rock game that gives you free dessert if you can stack up some amount of rocks up. Did it and killed it, as always the dessert didn't disappoint too."
"Omg! Hands down the best bbq in Arizona. You will be waiting in line for what feels like a lifetime but once you bite into your food it will all go away.
