"I get the concept of being a popular barbecue joint and running out of food regularly, but you shouldn't be sending your customers to your sister location because 'they serve food until late' without knowing if your sister location has any food either. We spent an additional 30 minutes driving to North Phoenix just to be turned away. Horrible customer service. Drove all the way from Gilbert and it was a huge waste of time."
"Wow! I had been wanting to try Little Miss BBQ's heavenly smoked meats since its inception, but did not want to wait in the long lines. They do offer pick up/to go orders for meat orders totaling 5 lbs. or more so I placed an order through e-mail for 5 lbs. plus BBQ sauce and sides. Note that you have to place an order about one week in advance for them to be able to prepare it for you (By 4 P.M. Friday for an order the following week). I invited some friends over so we could share in this meaty feast!

We got:
2+ lbs. beef short rib ($20 per pound, only sold on Friday and Saturday. Each rib is about a pound so you can get an idea of how much to order)
1 lb. pulled pork ($14.50 per pound)
2 lbs. fatty brisket ($19 per pound)
1 pint jalapeño cheddar grits ($4)
1 pint BBQ beans ($4)
1 squeeze bottle house BBQ sauce ($2)
Pickles, onions, jalapeños, and the happiness that you feel when you eat good food (Priceless ;) )

I received a confirmation e-mail about a day later with a pick up time of 10:15. We got there a little early at 10 and there were already about 5 people waiting in line before the official opening at 11. The order took only a few short minutes to be made and the cashier was friendly and cheerful. Apparently they had just completed an order for the Cardinals before we came by to pick up our meal. Nice!

The delicious aroma of slowly BBQ'd meat taunted us while we were in the car driving home. Opening up the packages was like opening up a present on Christmas day :). The brisket and short rib had an amazing rich bark on it, and all the meats had smoke rings for days... My favorite of all the meats were the short ribs. They weren't very short looking, as they were gigantic bones the size of my forearm. :) It was everything you'd want in BBQ: deep smoky flavor, lovely bark crust, and tender texture. The fatty brisket was my second favorite, also being very tender and full of flavor. The pulled pork was good as well, but it's harder to get brisket and short rib right so I applaud them on their BBQ perfection!

The sides were also quite good, and the squeeze bottle filled with house BBQ sauce was a steal at $2. I loved the tangy flavor, with perfect consistency, and not too sweet.

If you can plan ahead and invest in the bulk pick up order, this is the way to go! No lines, and you'll have amazing BBQ in the comfort of your own home."
"Sometimes a lucky culinary star just shines down on you almost like the tractor beam from space aliens and you alight suspended in its bright white light. Pure luck caused us to dismiss the hotel front desk telling us there was nothing good nearby so try Waffle House, and I hopped on yelp. When I saw bbq I knew I was definitely going up for wife of the year award because my husband loves three things in life: 1. Football 2. BBQ and 3. Me. We had arrived in Phoenix ahead of some friends and were rather at loose ends so we had some time to kill. How fortuitous. Yes the wait in line was about an hour and twenty minutes but let's be real: what were we going to realistically do with that time? Waste it like we've wasted the rest of our lives most likely. At least waiting for the bbq accomplished something. And was it ever worth the wait. My husband was blown away. The staff was great and managed expectations well and also handed out samples in line!!!! The people in line did not get cranky at ALL which defies all known principals of queue dynamics. They knew. They knew. We basically ordered one of everything when we got up there. Worth. It. Brisket was tender and smoky. All the sides were amazing particularly the grits. My husband spent the rest of the day engaged in digesting all the meat like a boa. He was so pleased he bought me YSL sandals. You can't miss it!!!!!"
Best bbq in town....but you'll need to get there early and be willing to stand in line. Brisket is so damned good.
"Yes Lawd!!! Pulled into the parking lot @ 9:30am on Saturday 2/23 received our ticket that secures our spot in line and we were # 40th. The restaurant opens at 11am.  There were people who showed up at 7am that day and yes team, it is worth the wait. Little M BBQ typically run out of the fatty brisket around 1pm when they are open and I see why. Brisket that is smoked for 12 hrs it just melts in your mouth and you can taste the seasonings as well. The smoke is not overbearing but you know it's there. We ordered the beef short ribs as well which was tasty and the meat just fell off the bone, we did not taste a lot of seasoning; however, it did have a good taste to them. The smoke turkey was off the chain as well. The baked beans were good, perhaps making them a little sweater and some BBQ sauce would take them over the top. The jalapeño cheese grits were awesome a must get! Finally, the smoked pecan pie.......this is a game changer hands down. Another dish that get's sold out. First bite you taste pecan, then you get hit with a hint of smoke taste.

They have a couple of tables inside and covered seating outside.

Little Ms BBQ is off the chain.

Michael who was directing traffic and organizing everyone was awesome and did a good job educating us on the process. His son Hayden toured us through the smokers. For a teenager, Hayden knew his stuff.

See you on the next visit."
Food is great. But nothing is worth standing in a line for over an hour!  U know ppl like your food so how bout remodel do something to speed it up. Been there 3 different times and every time its the same. My own home cooked bbq is way better and no wait here. Lot of reviews put in the not important pile so u get high ratings. Nice try. Line definitely wasnt worth the wait. Oh yeah new location is same bullshit. They dont open til 4pm. Stand in line like heard of cattle their too.
"Our family really enjoyed my recent haul of food from Little Miss BBQ. It's clearly one of the best BBQ places in The Valley. 

I bought three and a half pounds of Chopped Brisket ($18.50 lbs) and Pastrami ($22.00 lbs), along with some sides of Potato Salad, Cole Slaw and Cheddar Jalapeño Grits ($5.00 each). 

Sadly their Sausages, Turkey, Sliced Brisket and Ribs were all gone before we could get up to the counter.  Oh, well.  I did get the chance to meet some very nice out of town woman from Las Vegas; along with three men who arrived by Über from Sky Harbor, they just had to have some their famous BBQ. LOL

James and all the other employees from Little Miss BBQ were exceptional, as we waited over 45 mins.  Given the 107 degrees temps, the had the water misters on and made sure everyone was hydrated by offering us free water.  But truth be told, I found their Jalapeño Grits to be the best.  Just loved their grits. 

Enjoy!

Post Script - The earlier you come, the better your chances are of not being shut out of your favorite BBQ meat. Also, the meats can sometimes get dried out, even when wrapped in their butcher paper while being kept in the warmer. Caveat Emptor. 

PSS - Their Sunnyslope location usually has a short line."
"I consider myself a man with an experienced pallet. A pallet that has danced with the flavors of the world, a delicate samba- balancing between tones of salty and sweet speeding up and slowing with flavor like the tempo it follows. No I'm not quite a seasoned veteran, but a nice acquaintance with the spices, textures and seasonings we have to offer here on this place we call Earth. Now imagine my surprise as a thick hungry man when I hear the news we are stopping by a BBQ joint on the way to my teams excursion in Tempe Arizona- I'm enthralled with joy. 
 Now I will not be the first to say I am an expert in regards to the art of BBQ- I don't even have what could be compared to BA in BBQ, maybe a minor or some basic GE's in the arts of slow roasting a mean brisket. That's beside the point, in fact all of this is beside the point, what's important here, and what I am trying to express to you the reader, in the most precise words I can to paint a proper and worthy image in your head is just exactly what happened to me when I tasted the sweet and Smokey nectar of the BBQ gods we are lucky enough to call Little Ms. BBQ.
 Orson Welles once said ""ask what not can you do for your country. Ask what's for lunch."" Now I may not be the citizen Kane, but I think me and Orson (R.I.P) would agree about the value of a great lunch. Little Ms. BBQ was exactly that- a great lunch. Let me run you through the whole process here. I pull up in a new 2017 Toyota midnight blue (for the midnight crew) minivan into this janky little black top parking lot with one small building on the right side. Already the fresh aroma of slow cooked meats is creeping into my car like a cat burglar in your average suburban neighborhood, yet these scents are unmasked and not trying to hide from nobody. Piling up out of the store is a line of about 15 people, each one of them seemingly normal to the untrained eye, but with another deeper gaze, it is clear to see the aromas and mere thought of tangling their taste buds in this meat has them in some sort of trans- as if they were sailors at sea being called to their death by the irresistible sirens, yet this death wouldn't be one of tragedy and shipwreck, but instead a glorified funeral of flavor. I knew I needed these foods in and around my mouth immediately. I hopped out of the car quick, like a child pulling up to Disney land, and ran to the menu outside. There, behind the menu is was clear to see the line of meat smokers- the method behind the madness- these metal contraptions were the home base for our succulent little friends. 
 After about 6 minutes 23 seconds, I was finally able to order, there was no more brisket- only chopped- not sure what that meant but I could care less, a small bump in the road was not going to detour me from my meat mission. It was safe to say I was in full meat mode, ready for a fully meaty jacket, soon it would be saving private meaty cause it was about to be meatman down...you get the point. Any howsies- I get to the flippin front of line and with command that can only be compared to that out Gerard Butler in 300, ordered some chopped brisket, half rack of pork ribs, sausage, baked beans, cheesy jalapeno grits, and a slice of white bread. A meal that would have put all those hungry hippos into a state of couch lock. Now let me go onto reviewing these mighty meats for you hunny.
 The brisket- what can I say not even the passion used to write Shakespeare's Sonnet 18 could describe the love I felt for this cut of meat. Shall I compare thee to a summers day? No fuck right of William! How about shall I compare the brisket to the passion white people get when they see a NASCAR accident 8 Budlights deep!
 The pork ribs, of jesus the pork ribs. What could a mere mortal say and not undersell the tenderness I felt upon laying my fingers though these ribs. It's safe to say I'd give up half of my own rib cage just be in the same room as those ribs I just ate. Remember at the end of LOTR 2 Boromere died for the ring in a ball of glory and pure grit? Of course you do, who could forget when the art of film was perfected? I can't, and I also can't forget when the art of ribs was perfected right under my fricken nose.
 Now the sausage. Sausages have been being consumed for over 2,000 years. The word Sausage coming from the French word saussiche- based off the Latin route Salsus- meaning salted, shouldn't even be allowed to be in the same category of whatever I consumed today. That wasn't sausage, that was spiritual, eating that sausage was like what King Kong must've felt when he saw that blonde little smokeshow of a woman for the first time, or what Brittany Spears' felt when she was finally hit one more time. Shit absolutely fucking slapped.
 Now to the sides- the beans, who knew you could perfect let alone change the whole idea of bean. I was consuming these beans like Jordan Belfort consumed drugs. The grits made me cry tears of cheese. I reached the word limit so just eat here"
"Is this real life? This BBQ is the best BBQ that I have ever had and I'm from Texas. Tasty, cooked perfect, and mouth-watering BBQ sauce. I want to go back already!"
"I don't know why I haven't reviewed Little Miss yet! Everything you've heard is true; it really is the best bbq in America. Every single thing here is amazing. I don't like turkey and I don't like grits l, but I LOVE their turkey and their grits. Honey mustard sauce with the turkey is my favorite. I've had good luck showing up at about 1pm to find no line and most menu items still available. Love the staff too :)))

Don't forget a mini pecan pie! They're smoked and taste like nothing I've had before.

Apparently they're about to open a new location closer to downtown that will be more of a sit down restaurant, with the same amazing food!"
"I showed up before opening waited 2 hours, they ran out of most of the stuff, finally got inside and they only have one person cutting all the meats without changing gloves or area. The food was delicious but they need be more respectful about religious beliefs"
"Visited lake Meade and was looking for a spot to have bbq. Everything was good. The meat came off the bone of the ribs like butter. Brisket was a little dry. Mac and cheese was good. Service was great, refilled our drinks. Would definitely go back if I'm ever in the area."
"The meat is amazing!!! I didn't find a side that I enjoyed though. The mac&cheese wasn't cheesy enough, the cole slaw wasn't sweet. The pork ribs, sausage and pork belly was to die for though! They also have really good drinks frozen lemonade with ice cream. I definitely recommend visiting this place to get some great bbq in the phoenix area."
"Wow!  First time here.  I had the chopped brisket sandwich, cheddar jalapeño grits and ranch style beans.  With an orange Fanta.  These folks make some killer brisket, and the sides were excellent as well.  Tons of flavor!  Friendly service as well!"
"I have to admit, I was dubious of all the rave reviews. We waited in line for maybe 20 minutes. Sadly, the man right in front of us took the last of the sliced brisket. Our group had a pork rib, sausage, pulled pork, the jalapeño cheddar grits, coleslaw, the LAST pecan pie and chopped brisket. All of it was great. 

The brisket and pecan  pie we took home for my husband who wasn't with us. My husband didn't eat the sandwich until the next day but said it was still great. Now he definitely wants to taste it fresh. 

I've never been a grits fan but decided to give it a try to see if this one was actually as good as the reviews said. I really enjoyed it, similar to mashed potatoes but slightly different texture. To be honest, I probably would still skip it so I could eat more meat. I also wouldn't get a sandwich again, not because it isn't good but because the meat is so good I don't want to fill up on the bread. My fav was the sausage and I'm super picky (usually disliking it), but this was really good.  They have 3 BBQ sauces: house, spicy and mustard. All were good but the house was fantastic. 

To top it off, the owner not only serves (he was taking the initial order and chopping the meat) and passes out samples while chopping, then later came out to talk to his customer. 

We will be back!"
Great service and even better BBQ. Stopped here on a road trip and was extremely pleased. Better than most bbq I have had in Texas. All the people working were extremely friendly and attentive. Their outdoor misters helped to deal with the heat and the wait was not very long at all.
By far the BEST BBQ I've had.  I travel quite often and BBQ is always a go to for me.  The fatty brisket is incredible.  This will be a regular stop for me when I'm in Phoenix.  Great service and even better food-  highly recommend.
"We loved this place, atmosphere was great and the food was fantastic. Would highly recommend going  here for some great BBQ."
"Little Miss is so popular that they always sell out of their good stuff everyday so gauranteeing yourself the meat  you want (fatty brisket) requires a bit of an effort, but it's totally  worth it! Here's  the scoop: 
Arrive by at least 9am to grab a ticket. Parking can be hectic so you can choose to stick around or come back at 1030am to line up. (Honestly they didn't even check my ticket tho so I guess it's the honor system) Doors open at 11am. The line actually moves quite slow because there's only one butcher taking your order and slicing meat, one lady handling sides, and one at the register. 
On to the food! I ordered the 2 meat plate with fatty brisket and pork ribs.  Both were sooo tender, melt in your mouth. Makes a person like me, who's normally not too big on meat  BBQ, wanting to chow down and keep eating. Try their house sauce or their spicy one, their both great. Also get all the fixings so you can make a little sandwich with the bread, onions, pickles. I got 2 portions of Cole slaw as my side since none of the others appealed to me, which was a great way to balance out the meal. I've had better Cole slaw for sure, but hey it's some veggies! 
Reviews said to try their pecan pie, which was fun just because but honestly it wasn't good to me. I'd skip this. The crust is too hard, and the pie filling is this weird gelatinous sweet goo. Meh. 
But seriously their BBQ is really good, and I'm not even a big meat eater or BBQ person. I just wanted to see what all the hype was about and it was worth the ordeal! 
Also the line person, and the butcher were both super nice and friendly, made the experience nice. They also provide plenty of water outside while you wait, and pass out a free sample of some meat. 
I didn't order it but they also had beef ribs that day I went and they were gnarly (huge)."
I have eaten BBQ all over the states and I can truly die a happy man that I have finally had the best BBQ in the world. I feel like I have somehow cheated on my Kansas city people and roots but OMG this was just a delight and even though I waited an hour in line it was worth every minute. Wow
"By far some of the best BBQ I've had in my life and best place you can go to in the state hands down. "We went for dinner and called ahead to see what the lines were like and if they were sold out of anything (they weren't), so we headed over. The line was only about 15 minutes (as advertised) when we arrived. They slice your meat right in front of you. 

I got grits, slaw, ribs and brisket. The brisket is killer, the slaw ok, the grits were good. The ribs could have been bettah. Pork sandwich yum, yum.

Downtown location is small, but the foot is amazing. The entire experience, from waiting in line, to being served, to sitting down and enjoying an amazing meal is nothing short of authentic.

Is not a typical restaurant atmosphere (think picnic tables, paper plates and cafeteria serving line).

Some tables inside and some outside in the shade. Tiny parking lot so be careful. Will definitely come back again."

"My husband did a search for the best BBQ place in Phoenix.  This place made the list and it was the first one listed on the Yelp search.  So, we came to check it out!

Patience is a virtue and you will need it here!  My tip would be to arrive before it opens!

The majority of our time was waiting in line.  The time it took to order and eat was fairly quick.  Makes me wonder why the waiting time is so long!  We took our place in the back of the line which was near the last planter.  We waited for nearly an hour.  The nice thing is that they have a cooler with complimentary little bottles of water.  I'm sure it is unbearably hot in the summer time!  Also, there are a few camping chairs next to the line.

When it was our turn to order, we got The Jefe to eat there and some brisket, pulled pork, 2 pork ribs to go.  The Jefe is piled high with meats!  Mmmm!  If you make it to the ordering area, be sure to include the Jalapeno Sausage!  It is soooo good!  The staff will tell you to order what you want because it is all ""First come, first served"", and when they run out, they truly run out.  When we got to order, they were out of the Fatty Brisket and Beef Ribs.  

People sometimes leave their beef rib bones on the trash can.  We were able to snag 2 and take them to my brother's dogs.  

I heard the Fatty Brisket is superb, but I will have to try to get some on another visit."
"Super delicious! We tried their pork ribs, brisket and sausage they all great. Btw don't miss the 3 house sauces they're the best combination with all meats."

"The line literally was wrapped around inside when we went, pretty much as soon as they opened, on a weekday. It's worth it. We went to Phoenix for a day trip and wanted something different than what we've been having for the last couple days. We decided on BBQ and found some reviews for this place. 

The brisket literally melts in your mouth. The turkey was so moist and flavorful. I ended up with a two meat plate, and my husband who is a die hard pork fan opted for a turkey sandwich as soon as he saw it. Every meat plate is served with your choice of white bread, onion, pickles, and jalapeños. The plates also come with two sides. If I went back, I would probably not get the sides I did (coleslaw and beans). Both were lacking something. Coleslaw was dry and not super creamy, which may have just been the day we went, in not sure. Beans didn't have much flavor, which I'm used to with my BBQ. Especially in the south. Everyone ahead of us was ordering the grits, and I regret not trying those. Put the mustard based sauce on everything, but especially on the brisket. All of the other sauces are fantastic too, but I'm partial to the mustard. 

The service was quick. The guys behind the counter are knowledgeable, funny, and make you feel like you didn't just wait in some crazy ridiculous line between all their joking and conversations. There is not a lot of room inside, but outside has a lot more space with mist for hot days. The BBQ is great, and it is definitely a place we would try again if we are ever back in the area."

"I suppose this place has really good food. The staff is super friendly, and ensures everyone is well hydrated.

"What can I say that hasn't already been said?  

Ok, ok! you twisted my fork, uh, arm. 

I arrived at the joint 'round 2PM and the line-to-be-served was about 20 minutes. Par for my luck, the pork ribs and Smoked Pecan Pie were depleted just as I got to the counter. I refused to panic as this was my maiden repast and I knew I'd be back. 

I ordered brisket, sausage, beans and 'tater salad. 

The brisket was heavenly. End cut (I come from a long line of folks who like carbon, so the end cut and its smoky, dark bark is my favorite!).  Tender. Moist. Light smoke flavor. And it melted in my mouth. Perfectly seasoned...not salty at all. 

The sausage link was the best I've ever had. Seriously. Again, perfectly seasoned. Juicy. Already sliced into perfect, bite-size coins. 

Da beans, da beans, da beans!  I'm picky about my pintos and deez beans surpassed my expectations.  Chunks of brisket throughout. Creamy beans, creamy juice. Flecks of barbecue carbon and black pepper. Sublime, simply sublime. 

And then there's the 'tater salad. Any joint that uses red potatoes in any of their dishes has my undying love and admiration.  Small, incredibly uniform cubes of perfectly boiled red 'taters in a light mayo-mustard dressing.  Best, best, best. 

Lastly, their just-right selection of beverages includes...Drum roll, please!...Mexican Coca-Cola in sacred tall bottles.  If you've never had a Mexican Coke, go for it. They're just a tidge sweeter than gringo Coke. 

Arrive early or arrive late but getcha butt on down here and prepare yo big bad booty for a meal most heavenly. (""Elizabeth. I'm coming to getcha, honey!"")."
"This is hands down the best BBQ I have ever had!  My bf and I had it a couple years ago and have been plotting to eat it again.  We planned a quick 24-hours in PHX just to eat!  We arrived straight from the airport right when it opened and was told it would be a two hours wait.   Our persistence paid off as we arrived in F A T T Y BRISKET HEAVEN after a little over two hours wait!  The wait is not too terrible if you're friendly and chat with the hungry folks around you.  The most nerve-wracking part is the occasional meats update and the fear of a fatty brisket shortage!  We may or may not have conspired with our neighbors in line to jump someone with a huge tray of what appeared to be fatty brisket :P

Pro tips: Fatty brisket, pork ribs, beef ribs and sausages 

Skip (only bc we had limited stomach real estate not bc it's not delicious): pulled pork, turkey 

Sides in order of deliciousness in our humble opinion: potato salad, beans, jalapeño cheddar grits.

Don't miss the pickles, jalapeños and onion to offset the fatty deliciousness!

Service was amazing and super friendly!  Everyone was very happy and share the common love for Tecas- style BBQ!  Cannot wait to come back!"

"This is probably the best BBQ in town! Felt like I was in Texas for a moment. Be prepared to come early and still wait in line but It's totally worth it! It just melts in your mouth and the flavor is indescribable. Lol that beef rib alone was totally worth my $40. And yes there's only one bone with a pound of meat in it.! The brisket is also delicious but if I had to pick one it's gonna be the beef rib all day! The sauces compliments the bbq very well. I like the mustard bbq sauce the best.

The staff are friendly and they gave us samples while we waited in line. It's funny watching people reaction after trying the brisket. Lol it's so gooood!

"We first tried to get a chance to eat here on a Friday around 1:00pm after arriving to Phoenix from Sacramento,  but the line was still about 1 hour and the Pit Master informed us that the Fatty Brisket and Beef Short Ribs was pretty much Sold Out and the best thing to do is to try to come early Saturday morning to get a ""Pre Line Up Ticket""  before everyone starts lining up at 10:30 for 11:00am opening.  I woke up early to get there at 7:00 am when the Pit Master gets there to fire up the Smoker  for the day to get the First ticket in line..  I returned from our Hotel down the street at around 9:45am and watched the Parking lit fill up Every possible space Little Miss has and then some. The lines were wrapped around to about the 2 hour wait Point in anticipation to get some of the Special Fatty Brisket and Beef Short Rib. Crazy! Their rub and sauce (I like their original recipe) work perfectly together and the meat pulled of the bone with the gentlest tug. The only bbq we've had as good as this was in Austin TX. "This is on par with the best BBQ in Phoenix. The wait is ridiculous, since you could easily drive elsewhere in the time you wait to be served. We saw the line one day and skipped it but came back the following day 20 min. prior to opening. Wait time was over 1 hour from opening time. At least 75% of the customers are visitors drawn in by the great Yelp reviews.
Remember - it's Phoenix, it's near the airport and tire shops, the line is outside, the dining is outside, the food is hot. It's not like it's worth the wait to catch breathtaking views.
They offer to-go orders the day ahead which you can jump the line and get at opening time. That is the only way to go, in my opinion.
At least the food was delicious. There is never a reason to rush the art of BBQ, but since it's been smoking all night it should be ready to move. I'm sure they can find a way to cut & weigh it fresh while still getting it to their happy customers more quickly. They are opening a 2nd location, which speaks to the popularity of their craft.
The owners could be billionaires if they got local repeat customers, which unfortunately I'm not."

"My girlfriend and I came here for lunch today, and I've gotta say, it's probably the best lunch I've had in years.

Incredibly tender and juicy. The sides tasted great. The ambiance was great. The portion sizes are great for what you pay. Everything was great. "Just simply amazing BBQ meats.  No reservations, no ""buts,"" this is just the best BBQ meat I've had anywhere in the country, including Texas and all of the South.  Show up early, they keep selling out by shortly after noon, as more and more people figure out how good it is.  The brisket can be cut with the side of a plastic fork, and they give you the option to select fatty, drier, or burnt end if there are any left.  You can't go wrong with a mix of all of them.

On top of that, they are super-friendly and inviting.  They treat everyone like family and like the valued customers that they are.  The ""restaurant"" is just a simple dining area and some picnic tables outside.  You're not here for the atmosphere, you're hear for the smoked meats.

I also haven't tried the sides at all yet.  I just order meat.  Why bother with anything else?

This review is short because it's simple--awesome food with awesome service.  Just go there."

"3 stars. First timer. Ugh I really wanted to love this place. I adore good BBQ. I always get the same plate at every bbq spot I try; fatty brisket, sausage and potato salad. So I did my research and saw that if you get there early and stand in line, you will have less risk of having your desired item to run out. I've stood in lines at places before, usually good reason for a long line, right? So I stand in line excited and while they start passing out sausage samples, mentioned they were homemade. I'm so grateful they offered samples because I actually didn't like the sausage at all and it made me change my mind on picking it as a meat option. It had a funny texture, too soft and pushy in the center and the skins on the outside was tough and chewy, I spit it out. Flavor was just ok. I decided I would order fatty brisket and pulled pork instead at that moment. Now back to the line. I was absolutely stunned by the time my spot in line made it indoors. I can't believe they have ONE person making a plate per customer. Seriously ONE person? I understand wanting to slice and prep fresh for everyone, but why not make space for 2 or even 3 workers to serve plates???? The line could move at a much faster pace. Makes no sense to keep people waiting outdoors just to look cool. They passed out samples of the fatty brisket as well which was amazing and the best I've ever had. I ordered it with the pulled pork, potato salad and pecan pie. I hated the pork, threw it away, potato salad was bland, threw it away too. Pecan pie was good. I also got some pastrami Togo, was good, but make sure you know what pastrami already tastes like because it'll kinda be twangy on the first bite until you're used to it. Very friendly people working here which I why I gave another star. Please people get another server and put a end to people waiting so long over such an easy fix."
"There is no any other BBQ in the country tasting like Little Miss BBQ (PERIOD). This place is incredibly amazing! Super friendly staff and owners are amazing offering people free stuff, appreciating everyone for coming in here and taking a very good care of every customer. They care about the quality and not just money. Keep in mind that the wait is usually super long especially on weekends! You may need to wait for 2 hours but it's absolutely worth it! They don't have a big inside dining area but not a big deal because if not you can either seat outside or take it to go. The food is super tasty and the seasoning is fantastic! I don't want to spoil it for you but no matter what meat you get it will be a surprise in your mouth! Just FYI the fatty brisket goes pretty fast! It's so great and it melts in your mouth! Pork ribs amazing too so soft and it separates from the bone easily. I don't know how these guys cook the meat but it's just incredible! You have to try it to know what I'm talking about!
As far as sides; I love the beans the coleslaw is ok but not my favorite I wish it was more saucy. Haven't tried the beef ribs but a lot of people getting it and it looks pretty good! As far as dessert you can get the pecan pie and it's really good! Their sauces are amazing too! My most favorite one is the house sauce. If you like BBQ you this place is the must to try! "I was in town for my daughter's gymnastics competition, and decided to give this place a try.  For this review, I will be focusing on the customer service that I received from JOHN at the register.  John works the register and is also the person who comes outside before they open, and shouts on his megaphone to both inform and excite the crowd.  After placing my $526 to go order, I was ready to pay.  After paying with my credit card, John looked at the register Ipad screen, shook his head, and then made a loud and noticeable tisk remark.  He started aggressively bagging the rest of my food, carried it to an open table, and slammed it down.  It made a loud thud onto the table and he quickly walked away.  My friend who was behind me in line, paid for his food (also a to go order of similar size) right after me.  John bagged up his order, carried his order to the table beside my food, and gently placed it down on the table.  He then said to my friend, ""Thank you so much for leaving such a very generous tip!  It goes to everyone here who is working hard for the customers.""  He said so in an exaggerated manner and very loud, to make sure that I heard him.  I really wish I had called him out on his unprofessional, immature behavior right then and there, but unfortunately I didn't. "Absolutely worth the wait!
We arrived about 11:30 am last Friday, having just driven from Los Angeles.  While my wife found a spot at a picnic table, I waited in line for about 45 minutes, chatting with the people around me, and sampling the sausage that the owner brought out for the crowd.  I finally got to the front of the line and ordered a full BBQ pork rib plate (measured by weight at 3/4 lb.), with cole slaw and baked beans as my sides.  I returned to the shaded picnic tables (it was about 90 degrees outside), and my wife and I enjoyed some of the best BBQ we've ever had.  Each bite of the ribs was dripping with juice, and extraordinarily flavorful.  I decided quickly that the ribs needed no sauce (spicing was perfect!), though my wife tried the three sauces on the table.
We weren't in town for the ribs, specifically, but certainly enjoyed our lunch while on our way to our event later that afternoon.  Nobody batted an eyelash at the droplets of scrumptious rib juice on our shirts once we mentioned where we'd eaten lunch.
Mini pecan pies were on offer for dessert, but I can't imagine how anyone could have any room left."
"This BBQ is worth the wait, PERIOD!  I've been to both locations.  I've waited over 1 1/2 hours for brisket and spare ribs at the original location.  I've waited for 20 minutes at the new location.  I will wait again, SOON.  The hospitality is great.  The friendly staff and owners come around and greet you...sometimes with smoky treats.  Mac&Cheese is like moms...how'd you get her receipt?! The jalapeño, cheddar grits are yummy and the beans...there is chopped pieces of brisket in the beans.  OMG!  I look forward to the next visit to try the pastrami...Oh My Goodness!  This is a must try, bucket list type restaurant that you will absolutely love."
"My 2nd visit here! Absolutely the most savory and mouth watering bbq we've had! 

We got there an hour and a half before it opened. The line can get pretty long. We ordered the fatty brisket, sausage, potato salad, beans and a pecan pie for dessert.  THEY SMOKE THEIR PECAN PIE!  YUM!!

The fatty brisket is so tender and melts in your mouth.  You don't need to chew.  Once you lay that heavenly piece of meat on your tongue,  the smoke and the juices slowly start breaking down in your mouth.  WOW!

The sausage has the perfect snap while you bite into the tender morsels of the sausage.  Such a deal at $4.25 a sausage.

The Pecan Pie, it's hard to explain.  They're small, but shareable, but after you taste one, I don't know if you would want to share the rest.  Butter goodness in this pie and the sweetness in perfect.  And did I mention they smoked it?  You can taste that smoke, but it isn't overpowering at all.

Little Miss BBQ, Phoenix....GO NOW!!"
"I regret this rating and bemoan my disappointment because I did so want the barbecue promised in these Yelp ratings. ( One 3 Star, two 4-star and 67 FIVE Star ratings to date). 

We only had the brisket, moist of course, and maybe it is superior to the Arizona palate.  I am a South/Central Texan where barbecue is brisket and meat is beef.  The rest being mere novelty items, on the menu for the benefit of your in-laws from Up North or for shirt-tail cousins from East Texas and the rest of the Deep South who eat pigs.

I am truly sorry.  I liked the owner couple that served me and understand that she has Austin roots.  My brisket was tender throughout but inside the smoke ring it was bland and flavorless.  I wish them success all the same, but I won't be back.

You folks from New Jersey that like Joe's, Outback, Honey Bears, Daves or Chili's for links, baby backs, pork or (for God's sake) pastrami.....keep on plugging this place with 5 stars.  If you don't know barbacoa as a Sunday specialty, don't even bother trying to rate Texas barbecue; it is beyond your ken.

Central Texans...the closest thing to down home is still Rudy's at I-10 and  Chandler Blvd..

 P.S.  I was in Austin last month and asked an expert why the Líl Miss brisket tasted like roast beef in the center.  He said it was because they didn't smoke it long enough.  He said it was tender in the middle because it continued to cook in the foil after it was removed from the smoker.  

Maybe I was there on an unusual day when somebody was sick or hungover or something.  I don't know.  Everybody else must have known because there was no line at all and they weren't sold out at 3 p.m.   I won't be back to find out. 

I don't trust Yelp reviews anymore, they are mostly yuppie-huffy and with snowbirds from New Jersey writing glowing reviews about barbecued pastrami at Li'l Miss or foie gras tacos at The Mission in Scottsdale. Get real.  Plus I was just offered $20 each for positive Yelp reviews that I might write for businesses throughout the country."
"Uber'd from Arizona Grand Resort while on business. Arrived to a industrial area, no fancy stuff here. The line when we arrived was about 20people deep. While in line we met with one of the owners(forgot his name). Very nice guy spoke to us about his new location. Also have us a tour of the 3 camelback smokers they use. They were load with meat and ribs for the next day. As we waited the list of available Q was literally disappearing. When we made it inside there is a small area to the left where they have t-shirts, I had to get one. Got Up to the counter and the ribs, fatty brisket, and pulled pork were gone already. So I got some brisket, had some fatty on it, a side of jalapeño grits and slaw. Almost forgot I also tried the smoked pecan pie. I must say, the brisket was amazing, wasn't dry or chewy. Had the right texture and flavor. The grits were very good, with the right amount of kick from the jalapeño. The slaw didn't cut it for me. Almost did it again, the pecan pie. I had never tried smoked pecan pie, it was really good. This is one of those places when asked, you just say ""YES""."

"When my best friend Deb told me we'd be going here for lunch, I got excited, but not THAT excited. I live in a bubble and don't always know what's going on out there. She told me she'd pick me up at 9:45. AM. In the morning. To go to BBQ. Whaaattt???!!!

"All four of us in our party agreed that this was the best brisket we'd ever tasted.   There had been some growing skepticism in line -- and you should be prepared.  We arrived at 1:15 and faced an hour wait -- but the moment we tasted the product, all was well.   Based on suggestions from the staff, we all ordered the fatty brisket.  Do not be turned off by the term ""fatty.""  This is melt-in-your-mouth, tender brisket.   The best we've ever had.

Also ordered a side of pulled pork and while it was very good, the brisket is the order to have.    The smoked turkey also looks fantastic and might be worth ordering some, just to sample, but again... have the fatty brisket.

The sides were tremendous.   The cheesy grits and baked beans were first-rate.

The staff is incredible.  During our hour wait, various team members come out and chat with the folks on line -- importantly at the late hour we arrived -- giving us updated on how the supplies are holding up (i.e. ""we should have brisket for everyone up to this point, but we just ran out of pastrami"") and just talking with us about what they do at Little Miss BBQ.   The folks seemed genuinely interested in talking with customers and sharing their passion for BBQ.  This hospitality continued through every interaction -- waiting on line, ordering, and even settling up at the register.  I love the passion these people have for their food and their customers.

Be aware of the line.   I'm told the only way to avoid it is to show up around 10 AM and wait the hour until it opens.  So, not quite the epic Franklin BBQ line, but still a decent wait to eat lunch.  As I said, we got there at 1:15 and faced an hour wait -- plus, as it turned out, a decent risk of getting to the front only to find items we wanted were sold out.  This didn't happen, but sometime within 5 to 10 people behind us, the place did run out of fatty brisket.  So, I'd recommend arriving by Noon just to be super certain the place has the brisket for which you've come.  

Obviously, it's hot in Phoenix, but the line is shaded, there are misters keeping you cool, and the restaurant provides water (the workers even ask to make sure you're drinking enough while you wait).

This is a MUST eat if you're visiting PHX (like we were) or if you live there.  You are going to be hard pressed to find better BBQ anywhere.   Incredible food served by the most welcoming, passionate BBQ people you'll ever find.  5-stars for sure."
"Had the brisket, pulled pork and the jalapeno sausage with sides of baked beans and potato salad. The sides were eh... but we came for the meat! And yes the meat was good! We are not fans of heavily sauced bbq so we don't go out for bbq often because thats how most places serve it. The meat here is not slathered in sauce. It is smoky, flavorful, tender and delicious. The brisket is my fav! Sauces are on the table so you are able to add as much or as little as you desire."
"Lol  I saw what I thought was ""the line"" walking up...little did I know that was just the front and the line started way back like B.C.  Anyways I stood in line because I was going to eat no matter what or die trying.  Everyone in line looked so miserable, there should've been an IV hydration station truck in the parking lot, but when you get closer to glory there's a water cooler and they also have nice staff that check on you.  Finally I get to the finish line and let me tell you...I'D STAND IN LINE A MILLION TIMES OVER FOR THAT FOOD!!! IT WAS DAMN GOOD!!!! My only regret is that I didn't buy more food, but they were running out of brisket and I thought it would be unfair and gluttonous to do that to the others.  Morale of the story, bring a book, headphones, and come hydrated to grab some of the most delicious ribs and brisket EVER!!!!"
"We went to Little Miss BBQ for a dinner before going to Fox's and enjoying a smoke. 

Appearance: On entering Little Miss, I was in love with the pits outside the store. The line was at the door. As we were waiting, there's a spot where they prepare BBQ for serving. Some beautifully Barbecue turkey was coming out when we were coming through. The dining area was very modern, not the kind of place you typically associate barbecue with, but definitely a nice locale.

Hospitality: I'm from Kansas. I know of some barbecue places that will scare the piss out of you but make up for it in the food. The folks here were not that. They were super nice. I asked about burnt ends though and the lady kind of looked at me like I was an alien for a second.
While I was watching the guys carve the turkeys up, I chatted with the guy there too and it was obvious that these folks took pride in their work.

The Food: This was the one drop of the ball for me. Firstly, the food was delicious. I had the Brisket. It pulled apart by just a little tug of the fingers and had enough bark to give it some nice flavor. The real problem wasn't the flavor of the meat over all, but the fact that it didn't scream Barbecue to me. The rub they used was a bit too much pepper and not enough garlic, brown sugar, or cayenne. 
It was tasty, but for Texas style BBQ it was okay. Their sauces: The Mustard was a bit sweet, The home sauce was very heavily ketchup based, and the spicy was the same with a little kick. 

Overall Impression: The food was tasty, well cooked, I just had a disagreement with the sauce and the rub. It doesn't mean it's bad, it's really good actually, but not my kind of BBQ. 
Would I go back? Of course, the staff is friendly, the food is decent, but I might sneak in a bottle of Sweet Baby Rays."
"This is definitely the best BBQ in Arizona and arguably one of the best in the entire country.

I have been here a few times and can attest to their quality and consistency. 

My standard order is the two meat plate (turkey and brisket) with a sausage or two and a few sides.  

The meat and sauces are excellent, but their slaw and tater salad leave a lot to be desired.

I had to give them four stars, because I absolutely despise standing in line and this last time I waited for about 45 minutes.

With that being said, if you're visiting Phoenix and hungry for BBQ, Little Miss is the place to go.

Just get there early..."

"They use gigantic customized propane tanks turned into bbq smokers. The brisket is the most popular but don't pass up the beef ribs, pork ribs, turkey or smoked sausage made in house. Check their online website for price and ordering for pick-up. They sell by the pound and can be pricey, but let me assure you that you get what you pay for and it will be devine. "The best beef ribs in town and they are huge and meaty.

"You have not had good barbecue until you've had Little Miss BBQ.

First off, in order to do this place right, you need to be there at least 30 minutes before they open. This will help you avoid standing in line for about an hour. The wait is very normal here, and you should come here expecting a long wait, but trust me, it is so worth it. There is always a cooler filled with water outside.

When I first came to Little Miss they only  had one smoker. A few months later they were setting up a second smoker to keep up with demand. Before the second smoker they were closing up shop not long after opening as they were running out of meat. The second smoker helped. 

I recently went back about 2 years since my last visit and they now have a third smoker! It makes me happy to see that these guys are doing so well as they NEVER compromise on quality here. I've heard the owner say on multiple occasions he would try different things as long as he never compromised the quality of the food. It's good to hear somebody be so passionate about his product that he never compromises on quality.

The Jefe sandwich is a MUST HAVE your first time here. I think it's a great way to get a good idea of what this place offers. After that, the fatty brisket and the ribs are to die for! Your ribs are falling off the bone the second you pick them up, and the meat just melts like butter in your mouth. Their sausage is also homemade and is without a doubt the best sausage I have ever had in my life.

The ranch style beans are so delicious, as well as their jalapeño cheese grits. 

Little Miss is definitely a place that I am proud to take friends to. It's incredible and the owners are the nicest people you'll ever meet. 

If you are in Phoenix, you absolutely cannot pass this place up, it is a gem!"
"The best food I've had in my five or so visits to Phoenix! Yeah, I said it. 

My colleague and I came straight here from the airport for lunch. We arrived a little after 10:00 am and so had to wait an hour until they opened. Thankfully, they have chairs to tailgate and the staff was super friendly, so chatted us up and gave out samples until they opened officially at 11:00 am. 

We shared two two meat plates ($16) which let us try every type of meat and all the sides. I'd consider myself a side gal but wasn't blown away. We tried the potato salad, slaw, jalapeño grits and beans. I found the potato salad to be the best which surprised me because I usually don't love it. Their version is light on the sauce and doesn't have unnecessary additions like hard boiled eggs. Everything else wasn't bad but it was easy for me to save room for the meat! 

The star of the show is definitely the meat. If I HAD to pick only two, I would probably do the brisket and sausage, but it would be quite sad if you couldn't try the ribs. There were three types of BBQ sauce on the table and I rotated between all of them, not able to land on a favorite because they were so good. Everything was tender and packed with flavor. 

To end, we split a pecan pie which is a solid decision no matter how full you may be. It was super gooey and rich. Definitely beat the pecan pies that regularly grace my Thanksgiving dinner table. 

I found it funny that the Uber drivers that dropped us off and picked us up had no idea what Little Miss BBQ was. Its close proximity to the airport (and stellar Yelp reviews) undoubtedly make it a tourist destination but it clearly deserves the love."

"Wow! Wow! Wow!  This place has a well deserved 5 star rating! I travel to Phoenix a couple of times a year and a couple of years ago I missed out on trying this place because my impatient ass didn't want to wait in the line,  but never again will I make that mistake.  I will wait as long as I have to for BBQ as good as this.   

Waiting in line:  it looks long but it goes by quick and they are constantly updating the menu if they run out of things( they cover it with tape if they sell out) so  when you get to the front no surprises and it also helps with having your order ready when you get to the front.  
while you wait.  they have some chairs for you to sit on and plenty of water to stay hydrated.  They have line rules.  like it's okay to save a spot in line for 1 or 2 people, but not a whole group which I loved!  
and they have in the planters rocks for you to stack if you get bored. If you stack more than 13 you get a free pecan pie (personal size).

you get to the front of the line and they actually let you sample the meats.  and their meat portions are great too.  they day I went they had pastrami and turkey which I love both but had never had BBQ-ed so I was iffy about them, but they were both freaking A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!  so tender, juicy & flavorful. There wasn't a single thing that I didn't love at Little Miss BBQ and on top of that they have the sweetest friendliest staff.  I had an excellent experience.  The food and customer service are equally great.  If I could give them 10 stars I would.  They're the Best!"

"We arrived at exactly noon (an hour after they opened) on a Tuesday. 

Service:  5/5
Their parking lot is relatively small with a staff directing traffic, but we lucked into a spot.  Waited little over an hour and had three updates from the staff on the meat status as they were running low on Fatty (Moist) Briskets. Luckily, by the time we got to order, everything was still available. We ordered two 2-meat plates with an extra sausage to try out most of their meats.  Our order was right at the very end pieces of one brisket, but the cutter got out a new brisket instead and told us they only serve the highest quality pieces. He also let us taste some burnt ends on the new brisket. It goes without saying, the service from parking to waiting in line and to getting our food was extremely pleasant!

Food: 5/5
The Fatty Brisket is ""fill-in any expletive"" amazing! Perhaps the best piece of BBQ meat I've ever tasted and I have had my fair share of BBQ in Texas (Dallas/Austin/Houston). A perfect pencil-width slice with smokey crust that surrounds a perfect blend of fatty and collagen marbling. The first melt (I mean bite?) was an out of body experience.
There were no bad meats, but none comparable to the fatty brisket. The remaining in order of my favorites: lean brisket, sausage, pork ribs, pulled pork.
The sides were nothing special. The grits is worth trying, but I could do without the other sides (beans, coleslaw, potato salad). If you are feeling dessert, you must try the mini pecan pie at least once!

I've had a lot of BBQ over the years... and even the same restaurants vary by experience, but my first encounter with Little Miss BBQ is among the best 3 BBQ experiences I've had! 

Update: ordered the Super Bowl Special. 
Got a whole brisket. It's very dangerous to put 6-7lbs of Little Miss BBQ brisket in front of people without some kind of restraints. We chopped off the ends for nachos, sliced the fatty ends to make some sliders, and served the rest in slices."
"Good BBQ if you have the time to wait. They are so popular that there is always a line. That being said get in line! It will be worth the wait. Now this is. Not my favorite BBQ place but it is up there.

"So, the existential question is whether it is worth waiting an hour for sublime barbecue. And yes, the barbecue here is amazing. Tasty, non-fatty, beef and juicy pulled pork make for an amazing meal. On top of that, the sides -- coleslaw and grits in my case-- are as good as you can get. The folks here know their barbecue and know how to please their customers. This place isn't fancy and that's just the way it ought to be.  

Having said all that, I'm glad I did it but don't imagine that if I'm in the neighborhood I would once again wait an hour to eat barbecue. So, the bottom line is, if you want an experience and don't mind hanging out with some nice people for a while, go for it!"

"A referral said this is the very best BBQ outside of Texas.  

It's located in a very industrial park of town. It opens at 11am. We got there at 10:30 and got one of the last parking spots.  A local said the line starts 45 minutes to an hour before opening. 

I got the beef brisket and pork ribs and sausage with beans and cheesy grits.  The brisket glistened with grease, and had a beautiful pink smoke ring. It practically melted in your mouth, and every bight had a smoked taste!  Comparable to ""Bludsoe's "" in LA. 

The ribs were tender, meaty and delicious!

The sausage was very good: rich deep flavor with a skin the snapped when you bight.  The cheesy grits were out of this world!  

Generous portions: I could not finish all the food!

You don't come here for ambiance:  communal picnic tables with paper towels rolls and the 3 sauces.  

Down and dirty and delicious! 

Worth every bit of the Smokey, succulent experience!

The server was very friendly, and often gave the people samples from odd scraps on the well-worn cutting board. 

If I come back in town, I'd come back!"

"I fell in love with Central TX Style BBQ at Franklin's in Austin.  I don't like BBQ where it's drenched in a whole mess of sauce.  Sauce on the side yes that's A-OK!  If you have to pick a sauce.  My fave of their three is the tangy-spicy.  

And when it comes to TX the star of the show is the brisket.  Fatty or lean chopped up or sliced.....Little Miss BBQ delivers.  Personally if your only going to be here once go with the fatty brisket and the pork ribs.  Just melt in your mouth goodness and the smoke from the pecan and pistachio wood come through in every bite.  

Owners Scott and Bekke are constantly checking in on customers while waiting in line and dining and some of the friendliest people you could ever meet.  

The only side I personally recommend is the ranch style beans that had chunks of their home made jalapeño sausage but the cheddar grits although was good but perhaps not the ideal side to pair with BBQ.  The coleslaw and potato salad I would pass next time.  Nothing to write about.  On this particular day we were able to also get the Pumpkin Nutella pie and Bekke's Smoked Pecan Pie both ""baked"" in their smoker.  The pecan pie was a bit too syrupy to my liking.  I personally would pass on that next time.  But the pumpkin pie with drizzle of Nutella baked in is a nice touch.  I would get that again but it's not available everyday .  

Arrived here 40 minutes before they opened at 11AM on a Tuesday morning.  2 parking spots left when we arrived.  I've heard it's a zoo on Saturdays.  Glad I was able to stop by during the week!  

What to look forward to on certain days weekly.......

Smoked Lamb on Wednesdays.

Smoked Pastrami on Thursdays.  

Pork AND Beef ribs on Fridays and Saturdays.

Overall I'm giving LMB 4 stars.  5 stars for the brisket and pork ribs.  The sides and their pies get 3 stars overall.  At the end of the day it's the protein!  This is a must stop if your a carnivore in Phoenix.  Perhaps it should be your first stop if you just arrived at Sky Harbor from a morning flight cause it's right there!  Don't miss out."
"WOW! Worth the wait...not really sure I can enjoy such great quality BBQ anywhere else. 

We arrived a few minutes before 10am, found a parking spot and were immediately greeted by the owner? I think? Mike was his name. Wonderful, helpful and full of info on BBQ. He gave us a ticket and let us know to come back at 1030 to get our spot back in line if we didn't want to wait. Super flawless process for the crowd, parking, and getting in line. 

At 11, they opened the doors. We were the 50th person in line at that point and ordered at around 1145. 

Guy serving the meat was great too, the whole staff were attentive, friendly and seemed to sincerely love their job and the food!

Food speaks for itself. Tender, flavorful, juicy, literally the best BBQ. I'm concerned anywhere else I go, I'll just be thinking of LMB. 

Worth the wait and super impressed with the staff and how organized and friendly they were!! Love it!"

"This place is AMAZING. I've had BBQ across the entire south and this, I believe, is one of THE BEST. It's in the true Texan style. Get as much fatty brisket as possible because that stuff goes quick. Same with the beef ribs. I'd also recommend their pork ribs and pulled pork as well. Also, you MUST get the pecan pie. I was hesitant but man, one of the best pecan pies I've ever had the pleasure to taste. If you can, get the pie to go and grab some ice cream to throw on top. I'd go back here as often as I could. Just be aware, the wait in the Tempe location is real. It is well worth it."

The barbecue all had amazing flavor (ribs were my fave!!), the cheesy grits were to die for, and the brisket was great too. "Okay, now I know why they are 5/5 stars. It's so worth the wait!!! We came early just to make sure we get the brisket.

Have you ever had great flavors of meat just slap you in the face well look no further! You looking to get your stomach massaged by some meat look no further!
"Little Miss BBQ is so deserving of 5 stars and absolutely well worth the wait.  I've had BBQ from many places that are known for their BBQ like Raleigh, Dallas, Austin, St. Louis, Nashville, Memphis, etc. I would've never thought I'd have THE BEST BBQ ever in Phoenix, AZ.

Little Miss BBQ is located in an industrial strip. Their private lot is limited, but there are designated neighboring lots where you can park. Be sure to ask the employees as they can advise you on which lots those are.  

The restaurant is clean and simple. There are a few tables inside, but there is more seating outside where there are communal style picnic benches. We were able to snag a table inside, and it had a Warhol Campbell soup type of picture of a dog named Yager. One of the employees told us that Yager was the owner's dog, and she was often referred to as ""Little Miss."" Hence Little Miss BBQ! Pretty cool. 

Little Miss BBQ is so organized because of their numbering system. An hour or two before the place opens, it is first come first serve to obtain a ticket in line. (One ticket per person.) 30 minutes before the restaurant opens, you take your place in line based on your ticket number. There are markings on the property that tell you where to line up from and also how long the wait is from that point. 

The reason why it takes a long time in line is because there's one employee masterfully carving and also weighing the different meats per order. What's cool is that he cut pieces of samples to pass down the line. 

Customer service was exceptional at Little Miss BBQ. Everyone was super nice and helpful. I appreciated how the employee cutting the meats showed us the ropes of cutting through a brisket to get the lean vs fat meats. 

I loved every single thing I ate...

- The beans were more savory than sweet. The side was so filling and contained generous helpings of their pulled pork. This was my favorite of the sides we got.  

- The potato salad was refreshing. It was great as a palate cleanser. 

- The jalapeño cheddar grits were pretty good. The jalapeño was prominent, and it was definitely cheesy. 

- I don't even like pulled pork, and yet I thought Little Miss BBQ's pulled pork was delicious. They do pulled pork right. It wasn't dry or stringy. The pork meat was juicy and fatty. 

- The beef rib was excellent. The meat was so tender that it fell off the bone and can easily be cut with a fork. 

- The fat brisket was to die for. The meat was tender and flavorful from its pepper rub. 

- Little Miss BBQ's sauces were legit. There was a house flavor, spicy, and tangy mustard. I liked all 3 sauces, but the tangy mustard was my favorite. I thought the tangy mustard was going to be like a Carolinas-style vinegar based sauce, but it was far from it. It had a nice sweetness to it. 

- The Pecan Pie was amazing! The texture of the filling was a bit different than I'm used to, but that's what made it unique."
"So my husband loves to try out different BBQ places. So for his bday weekend we decided to take a road trip from San Diego to Phoenix, AZ to try Little Miss BBQ. Well... I do have to say we were not disappointed. Food was very good and flavorful. I loved the Jalapeño cheddar grits. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We woke up super early to be the 1st ones in line"
"They open at 11am but we got there around 10:30am, the parking lot was already filling up and the line as well, (my advice is to bring someone with you if you're going to lunch so they can fall in line while you're parking your car. If you come around 10:50ish, you're probably going to be stuck in the middle turning lane to go inside the parking lot and  stay where you're at in the middle lane until your it is your turn). Parking can be a pain in the butt. Anyways, I love their fatty brisket here, it was very tender, juicy and flavorful! I've also tried their pulled pork bbq and their sausage, both were delicious. The sausage was a lil spicy for me. The jalapeno grits & the potato salad were good too! Their pecan pie was to die for! I love Little Miss BBQ! I can't wait to be back! BEST BBQ in PHX!"
"You will probably wait in line. You will probably be greeted by the owner and other staff giving frequent updates on the stock they have left...You'll certainly be impressed with the professionalism and humor of the staff doling out the meat, the product itself, the rich sides contrasting the vibrant sauces. 

Went here twice on vacation, once at the start and before heading home. 

Relatively close to Phoenix airport and worth a gander but get there early for options."
"After reading so many great reviews, I have to say my experience was very underwhelming. In fairness, I arrived about 12:30, which is evidently far too late. After 90 minutes in line, they were already out of beef ribs, pork ribs and fatty brisket, literally everything I was interested in eating. I paid $20 for a two-meat plate with 4 slices of lean brisket, a handful of pulled pork, potato salad and beans, and a bottle of Coke.
I found the lean brisket disappointing. Not much smoke flavor and very dense. Definately not fork tender. The pulled pork and beans were very tasty, good flavors. The potato salad was horrible, no taste at all.
I get that this restaurant has limited quantities, but considering their popularity, they should have figured out by now how to keep from running out of most of their menu items two hours before closing. By the time I was half finished with my meal, they were out of everything but chopped brisket, sausage and turkey.
Were I to decide to come back, I'd probably be in line by 10:00. The beef and pork ribs that others got to enjoy looked very good, I'd try them. I would most definitely skip the potato salad.
The staff were excellent, very friendly.
Honestly, considering all the BBQ options available in the area, I don't find the food good enough to warrant the time investment it takes to eat here."
"OK, now, me n my buddies make some good ribs, chicken, etc and dont really like going to Rudy's, Famous Daves , etc since its Ehh ok.. Pork on a fork, ehh,, ok, no work n no cleanup i guess... But me n my coworker hit Lil Miss Tuesday, got there 30 min before they opened, n took about 30 more minutes after opening to get our order in. My initial thoughts, get ribs, pulled pork and brisket.. samples were being handed out before we got to the ordering, i reduced my order n only got a 1/2 b of ribs n pulled pork n got a full pound of brisket... mixed half fatty, etc,, omg !!! dude this place HANDS down best in AZ so far.. Some other patrons said its a spitting replica of Franklins,, whatever that is. lol.. but yes ,, worth the wait.

"Real deal BBQ with no equal in the Valley. By now I have tried every meat and side combination possible. If you have to prioritize a two meat platter, here's what you get: 

1. Fatty brisket. Embrace the flavor. Embrace the fat. Ask for a sample while waiting in line and let it melt in your mouth.
2. Pulled pork. While the fatty brisket is best without sauce, the smoky pork is the perfect conduit for their spicy BBQ on the table. Plus it's perfect for making little sammiches with the complimentary white bread, onions, and pickles. Get it on the rib if you prefer to gnaw on the bone. 
3. Jalapeno cheddar grits. How grits should be done! Creamy with the perfect texture and just enough heat and cheese to keep it interesting. 
4. Those beans. Swimming in sauce flavored with the cast offs from the brisket scrap basket. Peppery perfection. 

Wild cards: Pecan pie, pastrami (Thursday, runs out quick), and big ole beef ribs (Friday and Saturday, not available on two meat platter).

Been, done that, no reason to stand in line for 30 mins to get it again: Smoked turkey (boring), lean brisket (no comparison to fatty brisket), homemade sausage (good, not great), potato salad (nothing special), cole slaw (totally forgettable).

GET IT."

"I'm at a lost for word with Little Miss BBQ...because EVERYTHING was simply amazing! "I mean, when this has 5 stars and 200+ reviews...gotta be dang good right?? And yep, it didn't disappoint. Very friendly staff too, and that's always a super bonus.

Everything didn't have a lot of taste, but it's not supposed to be lathered with sauce like some places. And I say this is a positive. The pulled pork was soft. "Muy exquisita la comida de Carlos, la atención al usuario fue muy amable, me gustaría volver al sitio es muy agradable"
"Five star BBQ, best I've had outside of Texas and Franklin BBQ in Austin.

Must order items are the short rib and pecan pie, with a solid recommend to the pulled pork.

The short rib is a bit expensive, at around $20 per pound, but it was worth it. Amazing bark on the outside, well seasoned but not salty or leathery. Ask for an end cut. Tender, juicy meat underneath. Be mindful that the short rib cut has some connective tissue near the bone. Personally, I loved those bites.

The pulled pork was also quite good. Just not mind blowing like the short rib. Moist and tender, not overly greasy. I also liked how the pork was left in bigger chunks. Not entirely chopped and shredded. Very roughly pulled apart.

Flaky pecan pie crust with a balanced filling. Sweet but not cloying.

The sausage was only ok.  A bit too processed of a filling, like a hot dog.  I prefer a rougher chop of beef.

The chopped brisket was a bit dry. The slices had run out around 1 pm on a Saturday.

The coleslaw and potato salad were a bit watery. Proper Texas sides of white bread, onion, and pickle, though the jalapeños are a nice touch. I also enjoyed the mustard sauce, though it's heretical to Texas BBQ.

I wanted to go back the next day. What an awesome spot."
"Expect an hour wait but this as legit as BBQ gets. Had the fatty brisket, pork ribs, and jalapeño grits. Don't bother with sauce, it's awesome as is. I saved some of each for my wife who ate it warmed up and still loved it. Its a little expensive but just go for it if you like BBQ."

"BEST. BBQ. EVER.

"Arrived at 10:50am on a Wed. to claim the last parking spot in a lot with ~two dozen spaces.  Waited in a line behind 50 of so others for the next 90 minutes. I got the two meat plate of brisket & sausage with two sides of potato salad & baked beans (with complimentary pickles, onions, jalapeños, and two slices of white bread) & my wife got an order of brisket and cole slaw. "Fantastic BBQ, sold out of fatty brisket but the lean brisket and ribs were the best I've had. The coleslaw is more mild."
"Why 5 stars? Because the journey was worth it.

   ---   ---   ---

After seeing Little Miss BBQ pop up as the #2 ranked restaurant in the country on Yelp in 2018, I immediately bookmarked it and knew that I would absolutely be visiting on an upcoming trip to the Phoenix area. I landed at the airport, got my rental car and drove straight there... only to see that the line was so long that it just wasn't conceivable that I'd be able to wait. I had tickets to a spring training game and would have basically missed the whole game, which wasn't an option.

14 months later, I have another trip to Phoenix. I book an even earlier flight and clear my schedule for the entire day. Myself and a colleague arrive at 9:40a and are the first two people in line. Great success!

Because the aforementioned colleague and I perfectly align when it comes to these things, we basically picked out our favorite 4 meats and sides and shared everything. It's truly the only way to do Little Miss BBQ.

---MEATS---

Brisket: 5-stars. We were given a sample when we walked up to the counter to order and it was absolute perfection. While it was a tad better fresh out of the foil than it was 20 minutes into our meal, this brisket was about as good as it gets. It would be hard to find someone who says otherwise.

Sausage: 4-stars. There was a certain kind of flavor with this sausage that I couldn't quite put my finger on. I enjoyed it very much and it was so juicy that it almost tasted like when I bit into it that a little water would come out, as weird as that sounds. If you like sausage, don't miss ordering this.

Pulled Pork: 5-stars. I feel like pulled pork has the least amount of variance of any BBQ meat, but they certainly didn't mess this up. If I had to come back for only two meats, this would be one of them, along with the brisket.

Pork Rib: 5-stars. I really can't complain about these ribs in any way. When you imagine having some delicious ribs, Little Miss BBQ pretty much serves you what you day dream about.

---SIDES---

Ranchero Beans: 3-stars. I think the issue might be more that I just don't love this kind of bean. They were fine, but I wouldn't order again.

Potato Salad: 5-stars. The star of the show with the sides, IMO. It was a bit unique from what I'm used to with potato salad, in that the potatoes were diced into small cubes. I don't think I've seen that before. But more importantly, the flavor was the ideal pairing for all the BBQ we had on our plates.

Coleslaw: 3-stars. Pretty standard coleslaw - not bad, but not anything special.

Jalapeno Grits: 5-stars. Another great pairing to go along with all of the meat. If you're worried about this being spicy, throw those thoughts aside. I hate spicy foods and I didn't notice even a small kick.

---SAUCE---

Each table came with a bottle of standard, spicy and mustard sauce. I enjoyed all three of them. Just like with the grits, I didn't notice any kind of kick, so don't be shy to try it, even if you're not a fan of spicy things. I enjoyed all three sauces very much, but stuck mostly with the standard. 5-stars.

---CUSTOMER SERVICE---

An easy 5-stars. Every person we encountered wasn't just friendly, but ridiculously nice. I felt like I was at someone's house, rather than at a restaurant. And that's pretty impressive for a place to uphold that level of service when they have a line wrapped around the building every day.

It's no wonder that Little Miss BBQ has 2,000+ reviews and a 5-star rating. It's virtually impossible to keep that up, but I get how these guys have done it - they are awesome all-around!"
Best darn BBQ. From L.A. and look forward to this every year when going for Spring Training.
"My review of this BBQ restaurant is not based on the taste of the food but rather on how they handle the food. 

I arrived around 12pm and like everyone else waited for about 45 minutes to get inside and place an order. 
While mixing of beef, pork, turkey etc is ok with most, I do not eat pork so seeing them use the same cutting board and knife and the same gloves to handle pork was enough for me to leave without eating. Even if I did eat pork I would certainly not want my beef to taste like pork or beef to taste like pork, or turkey to taste like either. 
It was unfortunate as I had heard quite a bit about their smoked brisket. 
Perhaps for the sake of including Jewish, Muslim, and those who do not eat pork customers , they should consider using separate cutting board and knives."
"So the main issue I have is with the parking attendant, we had an order to go that was placed early so we went for our appointment to pick up the food. When I got there I parked the the far right corner and I had to take 2 spots because the way they have the parking curb stop was pointing at a 60% to the drive way. The attendant force me to repark and move in all the way and now my front bumper was damaged and he could care less.

Poor service poor attitude."
"I have to agree with everyone on the wait time... IT IS SO WORTH THE WAIT. I've had BBQ all over Texas... I am no Texan, but I can say that Little Miss BBQ beats ANY BBQ place I've been in TX. "Update to five stars! .. I won't even fudge the truth and will openly admit that I've spent quite a few hours in line (on different occasions) to get delicious food at Little Miss BBQ. The wait is always super long, even in the summer time, so if you're not a fan of waiting then I recommend gathering a bunch of friends together and putting in a to-go order!

I actually don't eat red meat at other places but when I go to Little Miss BBQ I save lots of space for lean brisket and cheesy jalapeño grits ... Sometimes the beans as well. The food speaks for itself & there really are no words to describe the deliciousness that is present on every plate. It's totally worth the wait! I actually really like getting one of the sandwiches best but since the wait is a long while, I get the 2 meat plate and save the leftovers for the next day.

Staff is always friendly & it's a treat to get a teaser bite of brisket before ordering. Of course I'll be back!"
Finally made it out here to check out the hype. Holy cow was the food fantastic! I arrived around 10:25 am and was met by an employee who gave me a ticket to save my spot in line. While waiting for the shop to open at 11 the staff came around and gave out some of their smoked sausage samples. At 11am the line was formed and we waited for about 45 mins until we made to ask for our order. While waiting in line staff came down and asked if anyone needed water and gave out samples of their fatty brisket and smoked turkey. The staff's level of customer service was phenomenal and based on the samples the food was amazing. While waiting in line they offered customer's the chance to come back and watch them wrap briskets and then reload them in the smoker's. They answered just about any question posed to them except their trade secrets. When it was my turn to order I got the fatty brisket and pork ribs along with ranch beans and jalepeno grits. The person I was with also got fatty brisket and smoked turkey along with potato salad and coleslaw. All of the food was amazing and the brisket was the best I have ever eaten. The ribs were juicy and the ranch beans were amazing. Everything appeared to be made from scratch and I cannot day enough of how great the food was. If you like bbq you definitely need to check out little miss bbq!
"This is among the best Barbeque I have ever tried in my life, and I'm very old! "It is honestly really hard for me to write this review because I really want to keep this place to myself and the others that know about this little gem on University drive.  I have been to Little Miss BBQ several times and I can say I have never been disappointed.  Your position in the long line matters a great deal because they honestly can sell out in the first 20 people depending what they order.  They have also measured quite accurately the amount of wait time you have based on your position in line.

All the staff and owners are very friendly and helpful at making sure you know what they are running out of so you can adjust your order if you are near the rear of the line.  I have had every single piece of meat, sides, and dessert that they offer and none of it will disappoint.  Overall, I feel this is the best BBQ hands down; it is the best I have had in AZ and even better then the places I have ate at in TX.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for great BBQ in AZ, but be prepared to wait.  Trust me though it is definitely worth the wait."
