"In 2015 when we first delivered our son to school here, one of the parents told me about a fantastic Bar-B-Que place right up University where the meat was delicious and the lines long and that they served until they ran out.  Because I wasn't familiar with the area, it seemed far so we didn't look for it.

Fast forward 4 years and I'm visiting the area and my son tells me of this great place for ribs he found.  When we got there it hit me that this was the place someone mentioned to me years ago.

Unfortunately it was Sunday and they were closed.

The next time I was in the area (a couple weeks later) we went on the Saturday before Superbowl Sunday.  I remember because they had ALL of the smokers fired up and it was a sight to see.  We arrived a little late and the line was long and by the time we got to the register my son got the last pull sandwich and I ended up with sausage.  We shared and BOTH were delicious with that great smokey taste coming thru in a way that only happens when the meat is cooked slow over the right kind of wood.

My last visit we got there early and my husband and son both with me.  We ordered Pulled Pork, Chopped Brisket, and the House Made Sausage.  They stick with the basics because they do them so well.  The meat was phenomenal and the House sauce was delicious.

I would say arrive early but still be prepared to stand in line.  If you arrive late and the line is long, it's possible to stand there for a while and then have them run out just as you get to the door, which is what happened to us the 1st time we ate there.  They do come out to say what has run out so you do have the opportunity to leave if that's the case.

It was so busy the last time I was there that one of the workers (owner maybe) had to direct traffic in and out of the parking lot.

There is seating in side but we opted to eat in the car.  It was a rental so..."

"Little Miss BBQ is someplace we were always going to stop at but never seemed to manage. We had actually planned on someplace else for lunch, but they were unexpectedly closed. When we passed by Little Miss shortly before noon there was no line out the door so we figured this was our opportunity.  Little Miss BBQ is in an open, very industrial feeling building. There really isn't any décor--just the menu signs. The place is very clean (as are the restrooms) and staff is quick to clean a table or bring water. There is a lovely covered patio, but not so good on a 110o day. Sometimes plain and simple is the best. I ordered the sliced brisket sandwich with a side of coleslaw. Hubby got the pulled pork. Meat is weighed so plates are consistent. I have to say that the melt in your mouth brisket was plentiful, moist,  and had just the right amount of fat on it. There were several bottles of sauce on each table. My vote goes to the house sauce. I did try the spicy one (overpowers the meat) and the mustard (ok, but maybe, better on pork). The coleslaw was classic--cold and crunchy. There are times when it is fun to try something new and unusual (i.e., artichoke hearts in chowder or hot sauce in chicken salad) but there is a reason why some things are classic and should not be messed with. I am so glad that Little Miss BBQ is run by purists. We have been put off by the endless lines we always see, but the 30 min.wait today was worthwhile. This is absolutely the best!"
"So we heard this place is the best BBQ in town and we decided to try it out. It opens at 11am and it was pretty hot and sunny day. We came around 10:30am before they open and we were shocked that the line was already long. The parking lot was a bit tight so we had to find parking then we waited in line. It was a hot day, but they're very thoughtful of putting the drinking water outside for everybody and they also have misters outside for us while waiting, it helps a lot especially around summer time. They have inside seatings as well, but it's pretty tight. 

It was an hour and a half wait. When we got the food, it was already 12pm. We got the smoked brisket, the pork ribs, sausages, and the pecan pie. Everything was delicious except the pecan pie, surprisingly; because pecan pie is one of my favorite dessert, but I don't like the pecan pie here very much because it was hard on top but jelly in the inside, it's like when you leave the pie out all night and it just become hard and I feel the taste was a bit off. The brisket and the pork ribs are full of flavors and very tender! Also they have the tangy mustard, spicy, and house sauce on the table. The services was great! They're very friendly even though they're very busy, but still smile and greet customers and they work very fast to get orders. 

I've got to admit that the bbq was good, although I wish the place is a bit bigger so that customers have plenty of room to park and more room inside to sit and enjoy the food. I definitely would come back again, but I would come back during cooler weather. :)"
"I got here just in time before they ran out of sliced brisket!!! Omg sooo tasty!!! If you can slice this brisket sandwich with a plastic knife, it's that tender!!! Yumm!! I'm glad I decided to make a pit stop here!!!"
"I can't eat anywhere else without comparing it to this superior bbq restaurant. I'm not the biggest fan of the sides but the service, the experience, and the meat is better than anything/anywhere else."
"Once you have a taste of their fatty brisket you'll never want to have it anywhere else.  It's clear they put a lot of love and attention into their food and it makes the wait so worth it.  I've found a new favorite place in Phoenix and I'm definitely planning on coming back every time I visit!

The food is simply incredible.  We ordered the fatty brisket, pork ribs, and pulled pork and devoured everything, although next time we're just going to focus on the ribs and brisket because those blew it out of the park.  We also got the cheesy grits and potato salad with the meal and I liked the grits, although I don't think the sides are that necessary because the meat is the star of the show.  The pecan pie was a great addition to the meal and just large enough to share between two pretty stuffed people.  Quite sweet with the amount of gooey filling beneath  the pecans, but complemented by a crispy, flaky crust.  Overall, you really can't go wrong with any of the food.

The wait is long, but worth it.  We arrived around 9am on a Saturday morning and were within the first ten parties in line.  We received tickets in order of our position and waited around for the next two hours.  The manager explained their policy that once you have a ticket, you have to stay on the premises to be fair to others, but unfortunately they aren't able to enforce it strictly.  The provide cold water and there's plenty of shaded seating, so it's not a bad wait.  Even though we were early in line, a few parties brought in a large group of people right before opening (hence the rule of staying on site) and people had big orders, so we waited 30-40 min after opening to get our food.  They hand out samples of sausage and brisket ends once the line queues up, which was a great motivator to stay in line.  For seating, there are a few tables inside and plenty of picnic tables outside under cover, so enough space for large parties if you're eating there.  Unless you get there early, I'd recommend finding parking elsewhere as the lot is small and fills up quickly. 

Overall, a fantastic place run by people who love what they're doing.  The only make enough with the intention of running out in the day so that everything is fresh the day it's served.  I'd highly recommend arriving early because waiting before the place is open is a lot better than waiting while watching people enjoy their food."
"Trust me it's worth the wait! We arrived about 10 minutes before they even opened and there was a line of at least 20 people. The parking lot was slam packed before they were even open for 15 minutes. It took us about 45 minutes to get food. People were ordering whole briskets to go. 
Between three of us, we ordered one of every item on the menu. Everything was amazing! I personally was a big fan of the grits and brisket with a slice of white bread.  The sausage was perfect!! Coming from Atlanta, we've had great BBQ- this is the best BBQ we've found in Arizona. I'm a fan of Joes too, but this is a different experience. I wish they had a dessert! :)"

Hands down the best BBQ I have ever had. We had a party of 9 and the front recommended 4 pounds and gave us a little of everything so we could try all of it. Great customer service!
"Not the worst, not the best. Had the lean brisket (they ran out of fatty) and sausage, with side of baked beans and jalapeño grits, and a smoked pecan pie. My wife also had the smoked turkey. 

The cons: 
The wait in line was nearly 2 hours. It felt like something special to be standing in the hot Arizona sun with so many other people waiting for this magical meat, so we stuck it out. Don't arrive hungry or you will go insane. 

I would describe the brisket as average. Definitely better than what you'd get at a chain but not exactly bursting with flavor or juiciness. The bark was somewhat disappointing and the smoke ring was not remarkable. Meat was tender, but I didn't get the intensity and richness of flavor I would expect from a slow smoked meat. 

The sausage, likewise, was fairly bland. The house sauce and spicy sauce were okay, but I would have loved an option with more tang (vinegar) to bring out the flavor of the meat. The sauces and the meats didn't feel right for each other.

The smoked pecan pie seemed like an off-the-shelf refrigerated single serving pecan pie you can buy at the grocery store. Not sure what makes it ""smoked.""

The pros:
The staff really go out of their way to keep you engaged while waiting in line, from chatting with you to keeping you updated on their supply every so often. The owner is really great at striking up conversation with everyone. 

The jalapeño grits were really great and satisfying. The baked beans had generous amounts of pulled pork running through them which definitely felt like a bonus. 

I had a bit of my wife's turkey and it seemed to have more flavor than my brisket, which I think is the first time that sentence has ever been said. 

For such a busy operation, they do seem to have figured out how to run it like a machine, from the one way traffic in the parking lot, to the signs posted in line telling you how many more minutes the expected wait is. I appreciate that kind of attention to detail. 

This place is definitely good eating, but when you take the long wait into account I can't really say it was worth it. I'm glad we tried it, though. I always like to see what people say is the best anytime I'm traveling somewhere new."
"LMB is my absolute favorite restaurant in all of Arizona. I have been here countless times over many years and always, always, always had a fantastic experience. I have introduced many people to LMB over the years, brought new roommates and taken dates. I always built it up with so much hype that, for a time, I used to worry if I was overhyped it--if, after waiting in line for over an hour, this person might be set up for disappointment. I no longer worry about that, as it's never happened. I've never once brought someone here that didn't end up telling me something along the lines of this being some of the best barbecue they've ever experienced in their lives (if not the very best). There is no way to overhype LMB, it just is that good. 

Even the experience of waiting in line is great, and I hate lines (who doesn't?). But this one's different. LMB is an experience, and the line is a part of that. There's just something about the energy and enthusiasm this place naturally generates among its patrons that seeps into you as you stand there waiting for your turn, grabbing sausage samples from time to time as they make their way down the line.

Everything here is good, you really can't go wrong no matter what you get. I particularly love the pastrami they serve only on Thursdays. Even the turkey is so good that, after my mom, who's not at all a BBQ person, tried it one Thanksgiving, she actually bought a smoker so she could try to replicate it herself the next year. But, of course, the thing you MUST try is the brisket (preferably the fatty cut). I can never seem to save room for the smoked pecan pie, but I often buy one to bring home and eat later. 

The new location is great too, by the way, and I love the extra side options, extra seating, and, especially, the alcohol, but the meat, for some reason, doesn't seem quite as good (though it's close), and I wouldn't recommend it for anyone's first time at LMB. Who knows, maybe the line really makes all the difference..."
"WOW. just WOW. let's just say there's a reason the line is out the door every day and why people wait in that line. i went on a weekday and was there about 20 mins before they opened, and the wait is more worth any disneyland line i've ever waited in, that's for sure!!

i sat inside, and the interior is modestly smalla and welcoming. it was very comfortable being there, and that has so much to do with the energy the staff brings. they love what they do and it shows. 

i got the three meat plate with ribs, pulled pork, and brisket. the service is so warm and kind that they asked me if i wanted a house sausage so i got that too! sides were the beans and cole slow, and let me tell you. i was not ready for biting into that brisket. nothing could have prepared me. it's smoked to perfection,  the flavor is incredible, and the fat melts in your mouth and sends it to the moon. the ribs are well seasoned and easily part from the bone, the sausage is incredible with their mustard sauce, the pulled pork is to DIE for... see where i'm going with this!?

honestly the best barbecue i've ever had. if you love tender and flavorful meats, fantastic service, and a dining experience nicely different from the norm, you need to visit little miss bbq."

"Ok.. I really didn't want to like this place -- my family and I are from Texas and lived in the Hill Country, I've tried the ""best"" spots all across TX (multiple times), and can't compare to my old man's smoked meats (30+ years experience with the smoker). I can confidently say that Little Miss BBQ is in my top 3 smoked BBQ restaurants!!! Walked up at 11am to see there was already a line forming --- parking is limited but there is a guide/greeter to help you, super friendly. They only let about 5-8 people in at a time to maximize a/c and attention. Limited seating and they won't let more people in until diners finish/leave or someone is there for take-out. Upon entering, we were greeted by the butcher/helpers/etc and blessed with a sample of their brisket. One bite into the brisket, I knew this place was MONEY!! I opted for the 2-meat plate (fatty brisket/pork ribs), add a sausage, and my 2 sides were potato salad and jalapeno grits. Brisket - 9.5/10 (right amount of trimmed fat, perfect moisture, and amazing rub). Pork ribs - 10/10 (again perfect moisture, consistent pull off the bone, perfect trim/rub). Sausage - 9/10 (just great all-around). Sides 10/10 (I know the jalapeno grits are all the rave, but the potato salad HOLY HELL was it good). Update **  James and Quinton Rock! They are following through with what they said!  Thank you so much!
"Sooo worth the wait! I love me some good BBQ! I knew from the reviews & my friend's experience, I was going to need to wait to give this a try. 

We arrived about close to an hour before opening to find parking & the guy gave us a ticket, so we had a definitely place in line. 15 mins prior to opening, you're able to go wait in line. It is a small space in there, so we opted to order & take it home to eat. I had 3 other ppl with me & we ended up having a little leftovers, but made sure we ate all of it during the rest of the day. 

They have misters out there for you while waiting in line as it can get so hot. They even have chairs as well in case you're too tired to stand & also cold water. Oh yeah, they also give away samples in line!

We ordered:

2lbs Fatty Brisket
1lb pork ribs
1lb beef ribs
2 sausages
1 pint potato salad 
1 pint beans
Pecan pie

When you get closer in line, to the side on the right, there is a rock stacking game. I seen this lady in front of me do it & she said if you can stack 10 or more, you get a free dessert. So I did it & took a picture for them to see. It was the smoked pecan pie & oh my gawwd, it was so good. 

It is a first come first serve. The line moves pretty fast once it opens, but they only cook a certain amount of the bbq daily. Once it is out, it is out, so plan accordingly. Definitely one of the best places of BBQ I've ever had. They put work into all their meats. It does not lack flavor & technique. Workers & owners were also super friendly to make out experience well worth it!"
I've cooked bbq contest professionally. And I've won. A fair amount. This place is the real deal. Get in line and order up. You'll thank me.
"My only mistake here was not taking a picture before eating! I don't know that I could say enough about how good this experience was, we preordered our food (beef ribs, brisket, sausage, cheese/jalapeño grits, and a smoked pecan pie) 2 weeks in advance and it was worth the wait. I would recommend the beef ribs over everything, just keep in mind they are over 1 lb. each! It is a tremendous amount of rich beef that does not disappoint and nothing else even comes close including the wonderful brisket. The service was stellar and all the sides and sauces were great as well. If you have been looking for great beef bbq in the valley you must go here."
"BEST PALCE FOR BBQ IN THE WORLD!!!

How dare Yelp take this off the hook restaurant off their top 100 list."
I came here after googling best of AZ. It doesn't disappoint. Be here early as I came at 10:50am and people already had a line ticket from waiting at 7 AM. We still got in as it was our last day to try from our trip from Las Vegas. This the best brisket I have ever had in my life. I put the piece in my mouth chewed and it disappeared. I thought they did magic or something. It was soo so tender and juicy. I will come back if I'm ever in Phoenix AZ.
"First Class! Best BBQ West Side the Mississippi! The prices are what they are, but the quality is out of this world. If they wanted to, they could sell their beef ribs for 30 bucks a pound and I'd still show up."
"Mark W here checking in on yelp from a place covered in flies. I chose to try this dump bc it's reviewed highly. this place is the most overrated place I've ever been to. All the reviews are most likely fake or from people who know the staff or management. This place does not have enough food and serves food at a snails pace. We waited in line 40 minutes they ran out of our top two choices as we waited in line. Three out of five people in our party didn't eat. The food was greasy and gross. Eat literally anywhere else but here. What a scam. I'll never be back here again. I would not recommend this place to anybody, unless of course I hated them."
"I have one word to describe this place .... AMAZING!! From the minute We got out the Uber , we were greeted with pure genuine customer service. This place was every bit of amazing!! From food to customer service, everything was phenomenal..we mentioned we were from Texas and the staff made us feel comfortable and explained the process of how to order!!! I would so Visit again when in AZ."
"Yes this place has the best bbq in Arizona if you're willing to put in the wait! 

The story goes, some guy who used to work at Franklins, probably the most famous barbeque joint in Austin, TX came to Arizona and decided to bring a little bit of Texas with him.  And I gotta say, this place does not disappoint! 

I definitely end up spending a lot more than I actually plan on spending, but it's the anticipation and wait that makes you do that. You literally will have to wait 1-2 hrs if you get there right at 11am. 

Definitely get the beef ribs if they're serving them. The sliced brisket is so juicy and melts in your mouth. I highly recommend getting the fattier kind. The pork ribs are good as well along with some sausages. They're super smoked tasting, and would be sooo good in a sandwich. I never bother with pulled pork and chopped brisket because I feel it'll taste the same anywhere I go. 

As for the sides, you HAVE to get jalapeño grits!!!! End it with a homemade personal pecan pie, it's super delicious! 

So I will say, the reason why the line is so long because once you get inside the shop, there's only one guy cutting the meats for you and weighs it, they really take their time to cut you the freshest and best pieces of meat. And can you imagine if a guy in front of you orders like 10 lbs of meat! That's why it takes so long! And yes the wait sometimes is brutal, sometimes even demoralizing and you just wanna go home. So is it worth it? It depends on your mood, you definitely can't go here on your lunch break, cause it's definitely gonna take more than an hour. 

But yes, the quality of the meat is #1! There's no other place in Arizona that has that good of meat! However I do rate on my whole entire experience not just on the food, and I would say I kinda like Joe BBQ more for the overall experience, not having to wait in such a long line, and the additional things they serve. 

But all in all, I still would highly recommend coming here if you're in the mood for some bbq. 

Tips:
1) they open at 11, if you don't wanna wait a long time, get there an hour earlier, bring your headphones, bring a book, bring a chair, bring something!
2) whatever you plan on spending, double it just in case, for some reason I always end up spending over $100
3) share with friends, it's a lot better 
4) get the beef ribs, pork ribs, sliced fatty brisket, and sausage, skip the rest
5) if you want sides, get the jalapeño grits! It's the bomb 
6) there's 3 kinda of sauce, ask for them all, they're very accommodating
7) there's pickles and jalapeños and stuff for free if you like that stuff"
"Didn't open till 11:45. Created a long line. Then takes 5 min to serve each customer which keeps the long line. Makes every one think MUST be good if the line is long. 

I feel sorry for those who thought it opened at 11, 1ar iin line, and had to wait 46 min to be served. SAD!!!"
"Don't think.  If you're at the airport just take the ten minutes ride and get some barbeque.  It seems like all the Uber drivers know the place. Now onto the good stuff... The meats. They're not kidding when they say the briskets are good. I was impressed by the fine balance of smoke, pork juices, and meaty goodness. Think of it as a ballerina perfectly poised on her toes. Surprisingly the sausages were on point as well. The texture was perfect with a bit of chew. If you're not sure get the ""Jefe"" sandwich with pork and brisket."
Any restaurant that sells food until they run out will be good. I waited for an hour and it was totally worth it.

"If you love barbeque then you will not be disappointed. I have family in Kansa City so I've been to a lot of barbecue places in my life. And this place is right up there with anything in KC.

I had some ribs and some chicken just to see which I would like better. And they were both so good that I still can't decide. 

Took of a star for the long wait and the parking. So be ready for that."
"Dammm good eats, saw on YouTube, had to tried it when we are in town, and we all loved it!!!"
"Will you wait? Yes. Is it worth it...?? Hell. Freaking. Yes. 
On weekdays, expect 1hr to 1.5hr wait minimum. Weekends can go up to 3 hrs
There's not much about this place that you need to read about, because words do not do it justice. But in case you need an explanation, go ahead and read below. 

Special Note: Lil Miss BBQ also have specials on certain days of the week. If I remember correctly, they serve beef ribs only on weekends, and pastrami only on thursdays. You may want to call to ask. 

Other Note: parking is kind of a pain. there will be a Lil Miss employee there to help guide you. 

Food 4 Thoughts:
- Fatty Brisket 5/5
- Ribs 5/5
- Sausage 4/5
- Sides: Potato Salad, Coleslaw, Beans (The beans are SOOO GOOD)

Thoughts 4 Food:
Now, when I say that the food is worth the wait... what I truly mean is the FATTY BRISKET is totally worth the wait. They usually run out of Fatty Brisket first. So if you're in line, and you get up to order, make sure you're ordering plenty. It is the typical ""pull-apart"" tender, and extremely juicy. If you do not enjoy ""fatty' foods, then order the chopped brisket which is a mix between fatty and lean. 
The ribs are sooo tasty. I loved them. Falling apart, succulent, and smoked, smoked, smoked. Some BBQ joints operate on a wet, sauce-based rub, which is good. I am more of a fan of the dry, seasoning-based rub, which I think this is. Good smokey taste. 
Sausage is good, but honestly i've never had a bad sausage at a bbq joint. 
The surprise ""must-have"" are the BEANS. It is mixed with some lean brisket, so it is super duper hearty.

Service is fantastic! Even though the wait is long, line moves slow - those are both a by-product of great food and great service. You show up to the line, and they cut the meat in front of you and weigh it. While waiting in line, expect to eat some samples given to you by the workers there. 

If this review doesn't convince you to go, I don't know what will. 

Chances I'll return: 100%"
Hands down the best BBQ in Arizona! Other places may taste good but when you get the juicy moistness that is Lil Miss you will understand the difference.
"Ordered a pick up order for my birthday celebration - AWESOME FOOD!!  Great job across the board - you can't go wrong.  I am not much for fighting the crowd and waiting in line - my suggestion - order online and pick it up and avoid the lines all together!  Brisket - awesome, ribs - awesome, brisket beans - were the favorite of the group, turkey - awesome.  I just wish I would have tried the pumpkin/nutella pie.

BEST BBQ in PHOENIX!  I hope they want to expand to the East Valley - I would happily help in any way I can to make that happen!"
